translations.text: And We also produced the tree which springs forth from Mount Sinai, containing oil and sauce for those that eat.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And a tree that springs forth from Tur Sinai, that grows oil, and relish for the eaters.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And a tree that springeth forth from Mount Sinai that groweth oil and relish for the eaters.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and a tree that grows on Mount Sinai, which produces oil and a seasoning for those who eat.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Also, a tree which grows on the Tor of Sinai and gives oil and relish for its eaters.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [We brought forth] a tree issuing from Mount Sinai which produces oil and food for those who eat.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have also created for you the tree that grows on Mount Sinai which produces oil and relish for those who use it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And a tree that grows out of Mount Sinai which produces oil and a condiment for those who eat.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Washajaratan takhruju min toori saynaa tanbutu bialdduhni wasibghin lilakileena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: also a tree growing on Mount Sinai which produces oil and a condiment for those who eat it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Also a tree springing out of Mount Sinai, which produces oil, and relish for those who use it for food.

verses.text: وَ إِنَ‌ لَکُمْ‌ فِي‌ الْأَنْعَامِ‌ لَعِبْرَةً نُسْقِيکُمْ‌ مِمَّا فِي‌ بُطُونِهَا وَ لَکُمْ‌ فِيهَا مَنَافِعُ‌ کَثِيرَةٌ وَ مِنْهَا تَأْکُلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به یقین برای شما در دام ها عبرتی است، از شیری که در شکم آنهاست به شما می نوشانیم، و در آنها برای شما سودهای فراوانی است، و از [گوشت] آنها [نیز] می خورید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: شما را در چارپايان عبرتى است. از شيرى كه در شكمشان هست سيرابتان مى‌كنيم و از آنها سودهاى بسيار مى‌بريد و از آنها مى‌خوريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و البته براى شما در چهارپايان درس عبرتى است از آنچه در شكم آنهاست به شما [شير] مى‌نوشانيم و براى شما در آنها منافع زيادى است و از آنها مى‌خوريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و البته براى شما در دامها[ى گلّه درس‌] عبرتى است: از [شيرى‌] كه در شكم آنهاست، به شما مى‌نوشانيم، و براى شما در آنها سودهاى فراوان است و از آنها مى‌خوريد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بی‌شک برای شما در (مطالعه حال) چهارپایان و حیوانات اهلی عبرت خواهد بود که از شیر آنها به شما می‌آشامانیم و در آنها برای شما منافع بسیاری است (مانند فرشها و لباسها و اثاثیه و باربری و فواید بسیار دیگر) و از گوشت آنها نیز تناول می‌کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در (چگونگی آفرینش) چهارپایان رهنمود مهمّی است برای شما (تا بدان به قدرت خدا پی ببرید). از آنچه در شکم آنها است (و شیر نام دارد) به شما می‌نوشانیم، و چهارپایان (جز این غذای گوارا و نیروبخش شیر) منافع زیادی (همچون مو و پشم) برای شما دارند و (به علاوه) از (گوشت) آنها تغذیه می‌کنید و سود می‌برید. [[«وَ إِنَّ لَکُمْ فِی ...»: (نحل / 66). «مِنْهَا تَأْکُلُونَ»: از گوشت آنها تغذیه می‌کنید. از آنها بهره‌برداری می‌کنید و سود می‌برید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و برای شما در چارپایان مایه عبرتی هست که شما را از آنچه در شکمهای آنهاست می‌نوشانیم و در آنها برای شما سودهای فراوان است و از [گوشت‌] آنها می‌خورید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و برای شما در چهارپایان عبرتی است؛ از آنچه در درون آنهاست [= از شیر] شما را سیراب می‌کنیم؛ و برای شما در آنها منافع بسیاری است؛ و از گوشت آنها می‌خورید؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا شما را است در چهارپایان عبرتی بنوشانیمتان از آنچه در شکمهای آنها است و برای شما است در آنها سودهای فراوان و از آنها می‌خورید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه شما را در چهارپايان عبرتى است. از آنچه در شكمشان است- يعنى شير- شما را مى‌نوشانيم و براى شما در آنها سودهاى بسيار است و از [گوشت‌] آنها مى‌خوريد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی برای شما در حیوانات نعمت‌وار همواره عبرتی است؛ از آنچه که در شکم‌های آنهاست به شما می‌نوشانیم، و برایتان در آنها سودهای فراوان است و از آنها می‌خورید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: There are lessons for you in the cattle from whose bellies We give you milk to drink, and there are other advantages that you derive from them, and some of them you eat;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed in the cattle is a lesson for you; We give you to drink what is in their bellies, and there are many benefits for you in them, and in them is your food.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And surely in the cattle there is a lesson for you; We give you to drink of what is in their bellies, and many uses there are in them for you, and of them you eat;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily in the cattle for you is a lesson. We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies, and for you in them are advantages many, and of them ye eat.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And Verily! In the cattle there is indeed a lesson for you. We give you to drink (milk) of that which is in their bellies. And there are, in them, numerous (other) benefits for you, and of them you eat.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And there is a lesson for you in livestock: We give you to drink from what is in their bellies, and you have many benefits in them, and from them you eat.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And indeed there is also a lesson for you in cattle. We provide you with drink out of what they have in their bellies; and you have many other benefits in them: you eat of them,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, in the cattle there is indeed a lesson for you. We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies. And there are, in them, numerous benefits for you, and of them you eat.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! in the cattle there is verily a lesson for you. We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies, and many uses have ye in them, and of them do ye eat;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: There is indeed a moral for you in the cattle: We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies, and you have many uses in them, and you eat some of them,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: In the cattle, too, is a lesson for you. We let you drink of that which is in their bellies, and there are many benefits in them for you, and you eat of them,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from that which is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: There is a lesson for you concerning cattle. We provide you with drink from their bellies and many other benefits. You can consume them as meat.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely there is a lesson for you in the cattle: We make you to drink of what is in their bellies, and you have in them many advantages and of them you eat,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna lakum fee alanAAami laAAibratan nusqeekum mimma fee butooniha walakum feeha manafiAAu katheeratun waminha takuloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: You have a lesson in livestock. We provide you with drink from what is in their bellies, and you have many other benefits from them; some of them you eat,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And in cattle (too) ye have an instructive example: from within their bodies We produce (milk) for you to drink; there are, in them, (besides), numerous (other) benefits for you; and of their (meat) ye eat;

verses.text: وَ عَلَيْهَا وَ عَلَى‌ الْفُلْکِ‌ تُحْمَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بر آنها و بر کشتی ها حمل می شوید؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و بر آنها و بر كشتيها سوار مى‌شويد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و بر آنها و بر كشتى‌ها سوار مى‌شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بر آنها و بر كشتيها سوار مى‌شويد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بر آن چهارپایان و نیز بر کشتیها سوار می‌شوید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و بر (مرکبهای راهوار) چهارپایان (در خشکی)، و (در دریا) بر کشتیها برداشته می‌شوید (و این همه فائده‌ی حیوانها و آثار و خواصّ اشیاء، مایه‌ی عبرت است). [[«الْفُلْکِ»: کشتیها (نگا: بقره / 164).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بر آنها و بر کشتی سوار می‌شوید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بر آنها و بر کشتیها سوار می‌شوید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بر آنها و بر کشتی بار می‌شوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بر آنها و بر كشتيها سوار مى‌شويد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بر آنها و بر کشتی‌ها (سوار و) بار می‌شوید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And you are carried on them and on boats.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And you are carried on them and on the ship.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and upon them, and on the ships, you are borne.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And on them and on the ship ye are borne.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And on them, and on ships you are carried.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And on them, and on the ships, you are transported.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and are carried on them and also on ships.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And on them, and on ships you are carried.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And on them and on the ship ye are carried.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and you are carried on them and on ships.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and upon them and on the ships you are carried.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And upon them and on ships you are carried.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You are carried by the animals on land and by the ships in the sea.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And on them and on the ships you are borne.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WaAAalayha waAAala alfulki tuhmaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and you ride on them as you do in ships.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And on them, as well as in ships, ye ride.

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحاً إِلَى‌ قَوْمِهِ‌ فَقَالَ‌ يَا قَوْمِ‌ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ‌ مَا لَکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ إِلٰهٍ‌ غَيْرُهُ‌ أَ فَلاَ تَتَّقُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و همانا نوح را به سوی قومش فرستادیم. پس گفت: ای قوم من! خدا را بپرستید که معبودی جز او برای شما نیست، پس آیا [از پرستش معبودان باطل] نمی پرهیزید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه نوح را بر قومش فرستاديم. گفت: اى قوم من، خداى يكتا را بپرستيد. شما را خداوندى جز او نيست. آيا پروا نمى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به راستى نوح را به سوى قومش فرستاديم، پس [به آنها] گفت: اى قوم من! خدا را بندگى كنيد، كه شما را غير او خدايى نيست. آيا [از او] نمى‌ترسيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به يقين نوح را به سوى قومش فرستاديم. پس [به آنان‌] گفت: «اى قوم من، خدا را بپرستيد. شما را جز او خدايى نيست. مگر پروا نداريد؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همانا ما پیغمبر خود نوح را (به رسالت) به سوی امتش فرستادیم. نوح به قوم خود گفت که خدا را پرستید که جز آن ذات یکتا شما را خدایی نیست، آیا شما مردم خداترس و باتقوا نمی‌شوید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای مؤمنان! در داستان پیغمبران عبرت و درس زندگی است) ما نوح را به سوی قوم خودش فرستادیم. او بدیشان گفت: ای قوم من! خداوند (یگانه‌ی یکتا) را بپرستید، چرا که معبودی جز او ندارید. آیا (از عذاب خدا و زوال نعمتی که به شما داده است) نمی‌پرهیزید؟ [[«أَفَلا تَتَّقُونَ»: آیا از عذاب خدا خویشتن را به دور نمی‌دارید؟ آیا با وجود این امر روشن، از پرستش بتها پرهیز نمی‌کنید؟]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی نوح را به سوی قومش فرستادیم، که [به آنان‌] گفت ای قوم من خداوند را بپرستید که خدایی جز او ندارید، آیا پروا نمی‌کنید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما نوح را بسوی قومش فرستادیم؛ او به آنها گفت: «ای قوم من! خداوند یکتا را بپرستید، که جز او معبودی برای شما نیست! آیا (از پرستش بتها) پرهیز نمی‌کنید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا فرستادیم نوح را بسوی قومش گفت ای قوم من پرستش کنید خدا را نیست شما را خدایی جز او آیا نمی‌ترسید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه نوح را به سوى قومش فرستاديم، پس گفت: اى قوم من، خداى يكتا را بپرستيد، شما را جز او خدايى نيست، آيا پروا نمى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی نوح را سوی قومش همی فرستادیم. پس (به آنان) گفت: «ای قوم من! خدا را بپرستید، برایتان جز او خدایی نیست. پس مگر پروا نمی‌دارید؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We sent Noah to his people. He said: "O my people, worship God, for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed for yourselves?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed We sent Nooh towards his people – he therefore said, “O my people! Worship Allah, you do not have any other God except Him; so do you not fear?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And We sent Noah to his people; and he, said, 'O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He. Will you not be godfearing?"

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly We sent Nuh unto his people, and he said: O my people! worship Allah; for you there is no god but he; will ye not then fear Him!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people, and he said: "O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other Ilah (God) but Him (Islamic Monotheism). Will you not then be afraid (of Him i.e. of His Punishment because of worshipping others besides Him)?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We sent Noah to his people. He said, “O my people, worship God, you have no deity other than Him. Will you not take heed?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We sent Noah to his people, and he said: "My people! Serve Allah; you have no deity other than He. Do you have no fear?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed We sent Nuh to his people, and he said: "O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other God but Him. Will you not then have Taqwa"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We verily sent Noah unto his folk, and he said: O my people! Serve Allah. Ye have no other Allah save Him. Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly We sent Noah to his people, and he said, ‘O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. Will you not then be wary [of Him]?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We sent Noah to his nation. 'Worship Allah, my nation' he said, 'for you have no god except He. Will you not be cautious'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We sent Noah to his people who said, "My people, worship God for He is your only Lord. Will you then not have fear of Him?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And certainly We sent Nuh to his people, and he said: O my people! serve Allah, you have no god other than Him; will you not then guard (against evil)?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad arsalna noohan ila qawmihi faqala ya qawmi oAAbudoo Allaha ma lakum min ilahin ghayruhu afala tattaqoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We sent Noah to his people, and he said, "My people, worship God; you have no other deity except Him. Will you not fear Him?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Further, We sent a long line of prophets for your instruction). We sent Noah to his people: He said, "O my people! worship Allah! Ye have no other god but Him. Will ye not fear (Him)?"

verses.text: فَقَالَ‌ الْمَلَأُ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا مِنْ‌ قَوْمِهِ‌ مَا هٰذَا إِلاَّ بَشَرٌ مِثْلُکُمْ‌ يُرِيدُ أَنْ‌ يَتَفَضَّلَ‌ عَلَيْکُمْ‌ وَ لَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ‌ لَأَنْزَلَ‌ مَلاَئِکَةً مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهٰذَا فِي‌ آبَائِنَا الْأَوَّلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس سران و اشراف قومش که کافر بودند، گفتند: این جز بشری مانند شما نیست که می خواهد بر شما برتری جوید، و اگر خدا می خواست [پیامبری بفرستد] قطعاً فرشتگانی [را به پیامبری] می فرستاد، ما این [سخنانی] را [که نوح می گوید] میان پدران پیشین خود نشنیده ایم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مهتران قومش كه كافر بودند، گفتند: اين مرد انسانى است همانند شما، مى‌خواهد بر شما برترى جويد. اگر خدا مى‌خواست فرشتگانى را مى‌فرستاد. ما هرگز چنين چيزى در روزگار نياكانمان نشنيده‌ايم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اشراف قومش كه كافر بودند گفتند: اين جز بشرى همانند شما نيست، مى‌خواهد بر شما برترى جويد، و اگر خدا مى‌خواست قطعا فرشتگانى مى‌فرستاد. ما در ميان پدران گذشته خود چنين چيزى نشنيده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اشراف قومش كه كافر بودند گفتند: «اين [مرد] جز بشرى چون شما نيست، مى‌خواهد بر شما برترى جويد، و اگر خدا مى‌خواست قطعاً فرشتگانى مى‌فرستاد. [ما]در ميان پدران نخستين خود، چنين [چيزى‌] نشنيده‌ايم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اشراف قوم او که کافر شدند (به مردم) گفتند که این شخص جز آنکه بشری است مانند شما که می‌خواهد بر شما برتری یابد فضیلت دیگری ندارد و اگر خدا می‌خواست (رسول بر بشر بفرستد) همانا از جنس فرشتگان می‌فرستاد، ما این سخنانی که این شخص می‌گوید در میان پدران پیشین خود هیچ نشنیده‌ایم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اشراف و سران کافر قوم او گفتند: این مرد جز انسانی همچون شما نبوده (و در ادّعای نبوّت دروغگو است) ولی او (با این ادّعاء) می‌خواهد بر شما برتری گیرد (و خویشتن را سرور و آقای شما گرداند). اگر خدا می‌خواست (پیغمبری را به میان ما روانه کند) حتماً فرشتگانی را (برای این منظور) می‌فرستاد. ما چنین چیزی را در (تاریخ) پدران پیشین خود نشنیده‌ایم (که انسانی ادّعای نبوّت کند و خود را نماینده‌ی خدا بداند). [[«الْمَلَؤُاْ»: اشراف. بزرگان (نگا: بقره / 246، اعراف / 60).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بزرگانی از قومش که کفرورزیده بودند گفتند این [مرد] جز بشری همانند شما نیست که می‌خواهد بر شما برتری جوید، و اگر خدا می‌خواست [بر شما] فرشتگانی می‌فرستاد، ما چنین چیزی در [سرنوشت‌] نیاکانمان نشنیده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: جمعیّت اشرافی (و مغرور) از قوم نوح که کافر بودند گفتند: «این مرد جز بشری همچون شما نیست، که می‌خواهد بر شما برتری جوید! اگر خدا می‌خواست (پیامبری بفرستد) فرشتگانی نازل می‌کرد؛ ما چنین چیزی را هرگز در نیاکان خود نشنیده‌ایم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گفتند گروهی که کفر ورزیدند از قومش نیست این مگر بشری همانند شما خواهد برتری جوید بر شما و اگر می‌خواست خدا هر آینه می‌فرستاد فرشتگانی نشنیدیم بدین در پدران ما پیشینیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مهتران قومش كه كافر بودند گفتند: اين جز آدميى همچون شما نيست كه مى‌خواهد بر شما فزونى و برترى جويد و اگر خداى مى‌خواست فرشتگانى را فرو مى‌فرستاد، ما اين را [كه نوح مى‌گويد] در ميان پدران پيشين خود نشنيده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس اشراف از (میان) قومش - که کافر شدند- گفتند: «این جز بشری همچون شما نیست، می‌خواهد بر شما برتری جوید و اگر خدا می‌خواست بی‌گمان فرشتگانی (برایتان) می‌فرستاد. ما در میان پدران نخستینمان چنان (چیزی) نشنیدیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The chiefs of his people, who did not believe, said: "He is only a man like you. He wishes to acquire ascendancy over you. If God had willed He would have sent down angels. We never heard this from our elders.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So the disbelieving chieftains of his people said, “He is just a human like you, he wishes to become your leader; and had Allah willed, He would have sent down angels; We did not hear this in the case of our forefathers.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, 'This is naught but a mortal like yourselves, who desires to gain superiority over you. And if God willed, He would have sent down angels. We never heard of this among, our fathers, the ancients.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then said the chiefs of those who disbelieved among his people: this is no other than a human being like unto you, he seeketh to make himself superior unto; and if God had willed, He would save sent down angels; we have not heard of this among our fathers ancient.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But the chiefs of those who disbelieved among his people said: "He is no more than a human being like you, he seeks to make himself superior to you. Had Allah willed, He surely could have sent down angels; never did we hear such a thing among our fathers of old.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But the notables of his people, who disbelieved, said, “This is nothing but a human like you, who wants to gain superiority over you. Had God willed, He would have sent down angels. We never heard of this from our forefathers of old.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But the notables among his people had refused to believe, and said: "This is none other than a mortal like yourselves who desires to attain superiority over you. Had Allah wanted (to send any Messengers) He would have sent down angels. We have heard nothing like this in the time of our forebears of old (that humans were sent as Messengers).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But the chiefs of his people who disbelieved said: "He is no more than a human being like you, he seeks to make himself superior to you. Had Allah willed, He surely could have sent down angels. Never did we hear such a thing among our fathers of old."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved, said: This is only a mortal like you who would make himself superior to you. Had Allah willed, He surely could have sent down angels. We heard not of this in the case of our fathers of old.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But the elite of the faithless from among his people said, ‘This is just a human being like you, who seeks to dominate you. Had Allah wished, He would have sent down angels. We never heard of such a thing among our forefathers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The unbelieving assembly of his nation said: 'This is but a human like you, who desires to gain superiority over you. Had Allah willed, He could have sent down angels. We never heard of this among our ancient forefathers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "This is not but a man like yourselves who wishes to take precedence over you; and if Allah had willed [to send a messenger], He would have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The chiefs of the unbelievers said to the others, "He is a mere mortal like you. He wants only to be superior to you. Had God wanted He would have sent the angels (instead of him). We have never heard from our fathers anything like what he says.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the chiefs of those who disbelieved from among his people said: He is nothing but a mortal like yourselves who desires that he may have superiority over you, and if Allah had pleased, He could certainly have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our fathers of yore:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faqala almalao allatheena kafaroo min qawmihi ma hatha illa basharun mithlukum yureedu an yatafaddala AAalaykum walaw shaa Allahu laanzala malaikatan ma samiAAna bihatha fee abaina alawwaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The leaders of his people who denied the truth, said, "He is only a human being like yourselves who wants to make himself superior to you. If God had wished, He would have sent down angels. We never heard about this from our forefathers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The chiefs of the Unbelievers among his people said: "He is no more than a man like yourselves: his wish is to assert his superiority over you: if Allah had wished (to send messengers), He could have sent down angels; never did we hear such a thing (as he says), among our ancestors of old."

verses.text: إِنْ‌ هُوَ إِلاَّ رَجُلٌ‌ بِهِ‌ جِنَّةٌ فَتَرَبَّصُوا بِهِ‌ حَتَّى‌ حِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: او نیست جز مردی که [نوعی] دیوانگی در اوست؛ بنابراین نسبت به او تا مدتی منتظر بمانید [که بمیرد یا از دیوانگی رهایی یابد.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او مرد ديوانه‌اى بيش نيست. يكچند بر او صبر كنيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: او نيست جز مردى كه جنون دارد، پس تا چندى در باره‌اش منتظر بمانيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: او نيست جز مردى كه در وى [حال‌] جنون است، پس تا چندى در باره‌اش دست نگاه داريد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این شخص جز مردی دیوانه به شمار نیست، پس باید تا مدتی با او (مدارا کنید و) انتظار برید (تا یا از مرض جنون بهبود یابد یا بمیرد).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او فقط مردی است که مبتلا به نوعی از جنون است، پس باید مدّتی درباره‌ی او صبر کنید (تا مرگ او فرا رسد یا از این دیوانگی بهبودی یابد). [[«إِنْ»: نه. حرف نفی است و به معیّن (لا). «جِنَّةٌ»: جنون. دیوانگی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: او جز مردی نیست که جنونی دارد، در کار او چندی درنگ کنید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: او فقط مردی است که به نوعی جنون مبتلاست! پس مدّتی درباره او صبر کنید (تا مرگش فرا رسد، یا از این بیماری رهایی یابد!)»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نیست او جز مردی که بدو است دیوانگی پس انتظار کشید بدو تا زمانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: او نيست مگر مردى كه او را ديوانگى است، پس او را تا هنگامى انتظار بريد- شايد از ديوانگى باز آيد و چنين سخنانى نگويد، يا بزودى بميرد و از وى باز رهيم-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «او جز مردی نیست که در وی جنونی است، پس تا چندی درباره‌اش به‌درستی انتظار کشید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He is only a man possessed; so wait and watch him for a time."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “He is not but a man insane, therefore wait for some time.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He is naught but a man bedevilled; so wait on him for a time.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He is only a man in whom is madness wherefore await for him for a season.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "He is only a man in whom is madness, so wait for him a while."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He is nothing but a man possessed. Just ignore him for a while.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He is a person who has been seized with a little madness; so wait for a while (perhaps he will improve)."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "He is only a man in whom is madness, so wait for him a while."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He is only a man in whom is a madness, so watch him for a while.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He is just a man possessed by madness. So bear with him for a while.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He is nothing else except a man who is mad, so watch him for awhile.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He is not but a man possessed with madness, so wait concerning him for a time."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He is only an insane person. Wait for some time. Perhaps he will come to his senses."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He is only a madman, so bear with him for a time.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: In huwa illa rajulun bihi jinnatun fatarabbasoo bihi hatta heenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He is only a madman, so, as far as he is concerned wait for a while."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (And some said): "He is only a man possessed: wait (and have patience) with him for a time."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ رَبِ‌ انْصُرْنِي‌ بِمَا کَذَّبُونِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [نوح] گفت: پروردگارا! مرا در برابر تکذیب آنان یاری ده.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: اى پروردگار من، اكنون كه مرا تكذيب مى‌كنند، ياريم كن.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: نوح گفت: پروردگارا! مرا در برابر اين كه تكذيبم مى‌كنند يارى كن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [نوح‌] گفت: «پروردگارا، از آن روى كه دروغزنم خواندند مرا يارى كن.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: نوح عرض کرد: خدایا، تو مرا بر اینان که تکذیب من کردند یاری فرما.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نوح گفت: پروردگارا! چون مرا تکذیب می‌کنند (و دعوتم را دروغ می‌دانند، نابودشان گردان، و بر آنان) مرا یاری داده و پیروز گردان. [[«بِمَا»: به سبب این که. در برابر تکذیبشان. حرف باء سببیّه یا برای بدل است، و (ما) مصدریّه می‌باشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [نوح‌] گفت پروردگارا در قبال اینکه تکذیبم می‌کنند یاریم فرما

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (نوح) گفت: «پروردگارا! مرا در برابر تکذیبهای آنان یاری کن!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت پروردگارا یاریم کن بر آنچه دروغگویم شمردند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: پروردگارا، در برابر آنكه مرا تكذيب كردند يارى‌ام كن.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (نوح) گفت: «پروردگارم! به (سزای) آنچه مرا تکذیب کردند، یاریم ده.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "O my Lord," prayed (Noah), "help me against them, for they accuse me of lies."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Submitted Nooh, “My Lord! Help me as they deny me.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'O my Lord, help me, for that they cry me lies.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Nuh said: my Lord! vindicate me, for they belie me.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Nuh (Noah)] said: "O my Lord! Help me because they deny me."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “My Lord, help me, for they have rejected me.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Noah said: "My Lord! Come to my help at their accusation that I am lying."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "O my Lord! Help me because they deny me."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘My Lord! Help me, for they impugn me.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (Noah) said: 'Lord, help me, for they belie me'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Noah] said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Noah prayed, "Lord, help me; they have called me a liar".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: O my Lord! help me against their calling me a liar.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala rabbi onsurnee bima kaththabooni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Noah said, "My Lord, help me! for they have rejected me,"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Noah) said: "O my Lord! help me: for that they accuse me of falsehood!"

verses.text: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْهِ‌ أَنِ‌ اصْنَعِ‌ الْفُلْکَ‌ بِأَعْيُنِنَا وَ وَحْيِنَا فَإِذَا جَاءَ أَمْرُنَا وَ فَارَ التَّنُّورُ فَاسْلُکْ‌ فِيهَا مِنْ‌ کُلٍ‌ زَوْجَيْنِ‌ اثْنَيْنِ‌ وَ أَهْلَکَ‌ إِلاَّ مَنْ‌ سَبَقَ‌ عَلَيْهِ‌ الْقَوْلُ‌ مِنْهُمْ‌ وَ لاَ تُخَاطِبْنِي‌ فِي‌ الَّذِينَ‌ ظَلَمُوا إِنَّهُمْ‌ مُغْرَقُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به او وحی کردیم که زیر نظر ما و پیام ما کشتی بساز و هنگامی که فرمان ما به هلاکت آنان بیاید و آن تنور [از آب] فوران کند از هر گونه ای [از حیوان] دو عدد [یکی نر و دیگری ماده] و نیز خانواده ات را وارد کشتی کن، جز افرادی از آنان که فرمان [عذاب] بر او گذشته [و درباره او قطعی شده] است، و درباره کسانی که [به سبب شرک و کفر] ستم ورزیده اند، با من سخن مگوی، زیرا [همه] آنان بدون تردید غرق شدنی اند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به او وحى كرديم كه كشتى را در حضور ما و به الهام ما بساز. و چون فرمان ما در رسيد و آب از تنور بيرون زد از هر جنسى دو تا و نيز كسان خود را به آن ببر. مگر آن كس كه پيش از اين در باره او سخن رفته است. و در باره ستمكاران با من سخن مگوى كه آنها همه غرقه‌شدگانند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس به او وحى كرديم كه زير نظر ما و با وحى ما كشتى بساز، و چون فرمان ما رسيد و تنور به فوران آمد، از هر نوع حيوانى دو تا [نر و ماده‌]، و همچنين خانواده‌ات را روانه كشتى كن، به جز كسى از آنان كه حكم عذاب بر او صادر شده است، و در باره‌ى كسانى كه ظلم كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس به او وحى كرديم كه: زير نظر ما و [به‌] وحى ما كشتى را بساز، و چون فرمان ما دررسيد و تنور به فوران آمد، پس در آن از هر نوع [حيوانى‌] دو تا [يكى نر و ديگرى ماده‌] با خانواده‌ات -بجز كسى از آنان كه حكم [عذاب ] بر او پيشى گرفته است- وارد كن، در باره كسانى كه ظلم كرده‌اند با من سخن مگوى، زيرا آنها غرق خواهند شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما هم به او وحی کردیم که در حضور ما و به وحی و دستور ما به ساختن کشتی پرداز، تا آن‌گاه که فرمان (طوفان از جانب) ما آمد و آب از تنور فوران کرد پس در آن کشتی با خود از هر نوع جفتی (نر و ماده) همراه بر و اهل بیت خود را هم جز آن کس که در علم ازلی ما هلاک او گذشته (یعنی زن و فرزند نااهلت را) تمام به کشتی بنشان، و به شفاعت ستمکاران با من سخن مگو، که البته آنها باید همه غرق شوند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بدو وحی کردیم که زیر نظر (و در پناه حفاظت و رعایت) ما و برابر رهنمود و آموزش ما به ساختن کشتی بپرداز. هرگاه فرمان ما (مبنی بر هلاک ایشان) صادر شد (و دیدی که) آب از تنور بر می‌جوشد، بلافاصله از همه‌ی حیوانات از هر نوعی جفتی (نر و ماده) را سوار کشتی کن، و نیز خانواده و پیروانت را سوار کشتی نما، مگر آن کسانی که قبلاً فرمان نابودیشان داده شده است (که همسرت و پسرت می‌باشند) و درباره‌ی کسانی که (با در پیش گرفتن راه کفر و ضلال و طغیان و عصیان، بر خود و دیگران) ستم ورزیده‌اند، (راجع به نجات ایشان) با من سخن مگو. چرا که آنان همگی قطعاً غرق خواهند شد (و دیگر جای گفتگو نیست). [[«بِأَعْیُنِنَا ... فَارَ التَّنُّورُ ... وَ ...»: (نگا: هود / 37 و 40). «أُسْلُکْ فِیهَا»: داخل کن بدان. مراد جای دادن و حمل کردن است (نگا: هود / 40).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه به او وحی کردیم که کشتی را زیر نظر ما و با وحی ما بساز، و چون فرمان ما در رسید و [آب از] تنور فوران کرد، در آن از هر [جانوری‌] جفتی دوگانه راه بده، و نیز خانواده‌ات را مگر کسی از ایشان که حکم [ما] از پیش درباره او تحقق یافته است، و درباره کسانی که ستم [و شرک‌]ورزیده‌اند، با من سخن مگو که ایشان غرق شدنی‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما به نوح وحی کردیم که: «کشتی را در حضور ما، و مطابق وحی ما بساز. و هنگامی که فرمان ما (برای غرق آنان) فرا رسد، و آب از تنور بجوشد (که نشانه فرا رسیدن طوفان است)، از هر یک از انواع حیوانات یک جفت در کشتی سوار کن؛ و همچنین خانواده‌ات را، مگر آنانی که قبلاً وعده هلاکشان داده شده [= همسر و فرزند کافرت‌]؛ و دیگر درباره ستمگران با من سخن مگو، که آنان همگی هلاک خواهند شد.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس وحی کردیم بدو که بساز کشتی را به دیدگان ما و به وحی ما تا گاهی که آید فرمان ما و بجوشد تنور پس جای ده در آن از هر کدام دو جفت را و خاندان خویش را مگر آنکه پیشی گرفت بر او سخن از ایشان و سخن نگوی با من در آنان که ستم کردند که ایشانند غرق‌شدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس به او وحى كرديم كه كشتى را زير نظر ما و پيام- آموزش- ما بساز، و چون فرمان ما [به عذاب‌] بيايد و [آب از] آن تنور بجوشد از هر گونه [حيوان‌] دو- نرى و ماده‌اى- در آن [كشتى‌] در آر و نيز خاندان خود را، مگر آن كه سخن [به هلاكت وى‌] از پيش بر او رفته است- پسر و همسرت-، و در باره كسانى كه ستم كردند با من سخن مگوى كه آنها غرق شدنى‌اند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس به او وحی کردیم که: «برابر چشم‌هایمان و وحی‌مان کشتی (نجات) را بساز و چون فرمان ما در رسید و تنور به فوران آمد، پس در آن از هر نوع حیوان (خشکی) دو تا (، یکی نر و دیگری ماده،) با خانواده‌ات روان کن - بجز کسی از آنان که کلمه(ی عذاب) بر او پیشی گرفته است - و درباره‌ی کسانی که ظلم کرده‌اند با من هرگز سخن مگوی، (زیرا) آنان بی‌گمان غرق‌شوندگانند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So We asked him to build the ark under Our eyes and guidance, (and said): "When Our command is issued and the source of water boils over, put a pair of every species in it, and your family except those for whom Our sentence has been passed already; and do not speak to Me for those who are wicked: They will be drowned.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So We sent him the divine revelation that, “Make the ship in front of Our sight, and by Our command – then when Our command comes and the oven overflows, embark in it two of every couple, and from your household except those upon whom the Word has been decreed; and do not speak to Me in respect of these unjust people; they will surely be drowned.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then We said to him, 'Make thou the Ark under Our eyes and as We reveal, and then, when Our command comes and the Oven boils, insert in it two of every kind and thy, family -- except for him against whom the word already has been spoken; and address Me not concerning those who have done evil; they shall be drowned.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then We revealed unto him, saying: build the ark under Our eyes and Our Revelation; then when Our command cometh and the oven boileth over, make way therein of every pair two, and thy household save him thereof against whom there hath already gone forth the word; and address me not in respect of those who have done wrong; verily they are to be drowned.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So We inspired him (saying): "Construct the ship under Our Eyes and under Our Revelation (guidance). Then, when Our Command comes, and the oven gushes forth water, take on board of each kind two (male and female), and your family, except those thereof against whom the Word has already gone forth. And address Me not in favour of those who have done wrong. Verily, they are to be drowned.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So We inspired him: “Build the Ark under Our observation and by Our inspiration. And when Our decree comes to pass, and the oven boils over, load into it two pairs of every kind, together with your family, except those of them against whom the word has already been pronounced. And do not speak to me concerning those who did wrong; for they are to be drowned.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thereupon We revealed to him, saying: "Build the Ark under Our eyes and according to Our revelation. And when Our command comes to pass and the oven boils over, take on board a pair each from every species, and also take your household except those of them against whom sentence has already been passed and do not plead to Me on behalf of the wrong-doers. They are doomed to be drowned.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, We revealed to him: "Construct the ship under Our Eyes and under Our revelation. Then, when Our command comes, and (water) gushes forth from the oven, take on board of each kind two, and your family, except those thereof against whom the Word has already gone forth. And address Me not in favor of those who have done wrong. Verily, they are to be drowned."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then We inspired in him, saying: Make the ship under Our eyes and Our inspiration. Then, when Our command cometh and the oven gusheth water, introduce therein of every (kind) two spouses, and thy household save him thereof against whom the Word hath already gone forth. And plead not with Me on behalf of those who have done wrong. Lo! they will be drowned.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So We revealed to him: ‘Build the ark before Our eyes and by Our revelation. When Our edict comes and the oven gushes [a stream of water], bring into it a pair of every kind [of animal], and your family, except those of them against whom the decree has gone beforehand, and do not plead with Me for those who are wrongdoers: they shall indeed be drowned.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We said to him: 'Make the Ark under Our Eye, and Our Revelation, and then when Our command comes and the oven gushes water, take onboard a pair from every kind and your family, except him against whom the decision has already been passed. Do not address Me concerning those who have done evil; they shall be drowned.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So We inspired to him, "Construct the ship under Our observation, and Our inspiration, and when Our command comes and the oven overflows, put into the ship from each [creature] two mates and your family, except those for whom the decree [of destruction] has proceeded. And do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are to be drowned.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We inspired him, saying, "Build the Ark before Our eyes and by the instruction of Our revelation. When our decree comes to pass and water comes forth from the Oven, embark in the Ark with a pair of every kind of animals and your family except those already doomed (to perish). Do not plead with Me for the unjust; they will be drowned."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So We revealed to him, saying: Make the ark before Our eyes and (according to) Our revelation; and when Our command is given and the valley overflows, take into it of every kind a pair, two, and your followers, except those among them against whom the word has gone forth, and do not speak to Me in respect of those who are unjust; surely they shall be drowned.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faawhayna ilayhi ani isnaAAi alfulka biaAAyunina wawahyina faitha jaa amruna wafara alttannooru faosluk feeha min kullin zawjayni ithnayni waahlaka illa man sabaqa AAalayhi alqawlu minhum wala tukhatibnee fee allatheena thalamoo innahum mughraqoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: then We revealed Our will to him: "Build the Ark under Our watchful eye according to Our instructions. When Our command comes, and waters gush up out of the earth, take on board pairs of every species and members of your household, except for any of them on whom sentence has already been passed -- do not plead with Me for those who have done wrong: they shall be drowned.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So We inspired him (with this message): "Construct the Ark within Our sight and under Our guidance: then when comes Our Command, and the fountains of the earth gush forth, take thou on board pairs of every species, male and female, and thy family- except those of them against whom the Word has already gone forth: And address Me not in favour of the wrong-doers; for they shall be drowned (in the Flood).

verses.text: فَإِذَا اسْتَوَيْتَ‌ أَنْتَ‌ وَ مَنْ‌ مَعَکَ‌ عَلَى‌ الْفُلْکِ‌ فَقُلِ‌ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ‌ الَّذِي‌ نَجَّانَا مِنَ‌ الْقَوْمِ‌ الظَّالِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس هنگامی که تو و آنان که با تو هستند، بر کشتی سوار شدید، به خاطر این نعمت بگو: همه ستایش ها ویژه خداست که ما را از این گروه ستم پیشه نجات داد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون خود و همراهانت به كشتى نشستيد، بگو: سپاس خدايى را كه ما را از مردم ستمكاره رهايى بخشيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چون تو با همراهانت بر كشتى نشستى، بگو: ستايش خدايى را كه ما را از چنگ گروه ستمگران رهانيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چون تو با آنان كه همراه تواند بر كشتى نشستى بگو: «ستايش خدايى را كه ما را از [چنگ‌] گروه ظالمان رهانيد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس چون با همراهانت در کشتی نشستی بگو: ستایش خدای را که ما را از (ظلم) ستمکاران نجات داد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هرگاه تو و همراهانت بر کشتی (سوار شدی و) استقرار یافتی، بگو: شکر و سپاس خداوندی را سزا است که ما را از دست قوم ستمگر رهانید. [[«إسْتَوَیْتَ»: استقرار یافتی و جای گرفتی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چون تو و همراهانت بر کشتی قرار گرفتید، آنگاه بگو سپاس خداوندی را که ما را از قوم ستم پیشه [و مشرک‌] رهانید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و هنگامی که تو و همه کسانی که با تو هستند بر کشتی سوار شدید، بگو: «ستایش برای خدایی است که ما را از قوم ستمگر نجات بخشید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گاهی که استوار شدی تو و آنکه با تو است در کشتی بگو سپاس خدائی را که رهائید ما را از گروه ستمگران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چون تو و همراهانت بر كشتى آرام گرفتيد، بگو: سپاس و ستايش خداى را كه ما را از اين قوم ستمكار رهايى داد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پس هنگامی که تو با همراهانت بر کشتی آرمیدی، بگو ستایش خدایی را (سزا)ست که ما را از (چنگ) گروه ظالمان رهانید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When you and those with you have boarded the ark, say: 'All praise be to God who has delivered us from the people who were sinful.'

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And when you and those with you have safely boarded the ship say, ‘All praise is to Allah Who has rescued us from the unjust.’”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then, when thou art seated in the Ark and those with thee, say, "Praise belongs to God, who has delivered us from the people of the evildoers."

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And when thou art settled, thou and those with thee, in the ark, say thou: praise unto Allah who hath delivered us from the wrong doing people.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And when you have embarked on the ship, you and whoever is with you, then say: "All the praises and thanks be to Allah, Who has saved us from the people who are Zalimun (i.e. oppressors, wrong-doers, polytheists, those who join others in worship with Allah, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then, when you and those with you are settled in the Ark, say, “Praise be to God, who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And then when you and those accompanying you are firmly seated in the Ark, say: "Thanks be to Allah Who has delivered us from the wrong-doing people."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And when you have embarked on the ship, you and whoever is with you, then say: `All the praise be to Allah, Who has saved us from the people who are wrongdoers."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when thou art on board the ship, thou and whoso is with thee, then say: Praise be to Allah Who hath saved us from the wrongdoing folk!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘When you, and those who are with you, are settled in the ark, say, ‘‘All praise belongs to Allah, who has delivered us from the wrongdoing lot.’’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And when you and all those with you are seated in the Ark, say: 'Praise be to Allah who has saved us from the harmdoing nation'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And when you have boarded the ship, you and those with you, then say, 'Praise to Allah who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.'

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When all of you settle in the Ark, say, "Only God Who has saved us from the unjust people deserves all praise".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And when you are firmly seated, you and those with you, in the ark, say: All praise is due to Allah who delivered us from the unjust people:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faitha istawayta anta waman maAAaka AAala alfulki faquli alhamdu lillahi allathee najjana mina alqawmi alththalimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When you and all your followers have settled in the Ark, say, "Praise be to God who has delivered us from a wicked people,"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And when thou hast embarked on the Ark - thou and those with thee,- say: "Praise be to Allah, Who has saved us from the people who do wrong."

verses.text: وَ قُلْ‌ رَبِ‌ أَنْزِلْنِي‌ مُنْزَلاً مُبَارَکاً وَ أَنْتَ‌ خَيْرُ الْمُنْزِلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بگو: پروردگارا! مرا در جایگاهی پرخیر و برکت فرود آور، که تو بهترین فرودآورندگانی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و بگو: اى پروردگار من، مرا فرود آور در جايگاهى مبارك، كه تو بهترين راهبرانى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و بگو: پروردگارا! مرا در جايى پر بركت فرود آور، كه تو بهترين فرود آرندگانى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بگو: «پروردگارا، مرا در جايى پربركت فرود آور [كه‌] تو نيكترين مهمان‌نوازانى.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و باز بگو: پروردگارا، مرا به منزلی مبارک فرود آور که تو بهترین کسی هستی که به منزل خیر و سعادت توانی فرود آورد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و بگو: پروردگارا! مرا در جایگاه پرخیر و برکتی فرود آور و تو بهترین فرودآورندگانی. [[«مُنزَلاً»: جایگاه نزول. یا مصدر میمی است و به معنی انزال، یعنی: فرود آوردن است. با توجّه به معنی دوم، مفهوم چنین خواهد بود: و بگو: پروردگارا! مرا نیکو و باخیر و برکت فرود آور.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بگو پروردگارا مرا به منزلی مبارک فرود آور و تو بهترین میزبانانی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بگو: «پروردگارا! ما را در منزلگاهی پربرکت فرود آر، و تو بهترین فرودآورندگانی!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بگو پروردگارا فرود آور مرا فرودگاهی فرخنده و توئی بهترین فرودآرندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بگو: پروردگارا، مرا در جايى با بركت فرود آر و تو بهترين فرودآرندگانى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بگو: «پروردگارم! مرا در فرودگاهی پر برکت فرود آر، حال آنکه تو نیک‌ترین فرودآورندگانی.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And say: 'O Lord, disembark me in a welcome place; You are the best of deliverers.'

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And pray, “My Lord! Cause me to alight at a blessed place – and You are the Best of all who bring to settle.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And say, "'O my Lord, do Thou harbour me in a blessed harbour, for Thou art the best of harbourers."

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And say thou, my Lord! cause me to land at a landing blest, and thou art the Best of these who bring to land.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And say: "My Lord! Cause me to land at a blessed landing-place, for You are the Best of those who bring to land."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And say, “My Lord, land me with a blessed landing, as you are the best of transporters.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And say: "My Lord! Make my landing a blessed landing, for You are the Best of those Who can cause people to land in safety."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And say: `My Lord! Cause me to land at a blessed landing place, for You are the Best of those who bring to land."'

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And say: My Lord! Cause me to land at a blessed landing-place, for Thou art Best of all who bring to land.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And say, ‘‘My Lord! Land me with a blessed landing, for You are the best of those who bring ashore.’’ ’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And say: 'Lord, let me land a blessed landing. You are the Best of harborers'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And say, 'My Lord, let me land at a blessed landing place, and You are the best to accommodate [us].' "

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Say, "Lord, grant us a blessed landing from the Ark; You are the One who provides the safest landing".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And say: O my Lord! cause me to disembark a blessed alighting, and Thou art the best to cause to alight.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqul rabbi anzilnee munzalan mubarakan waanta khayru almunzileena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and say, 'My Lord, let me land with Your blessing in a blessed landing place. You alone can provide the best landings.'"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And say: "O my Lord! enable me to disembark with thy blessing: for Thou art the Best to enable (us) to disembark."

verses.text: إِنَ‌ فِي‌ ذٰلِکَ‌ لَآيَاتٍ‌ وَ إِنْ‌ کُنَّا لَمُبْتَلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همانا در این [سرگذشت] نشانه هایی [از قدرت، رحمت و انتقام خدا] برای عبرت گیرندگان است؛ و یقیناً ما آزمایش کننده بندگانیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در اين داستان عبرتها و پندهاست، و ما تنها آزمايندگانى بوديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در حقيقت، در اين [ماجرا] عبرت‌هايى است، و ما همواره آزمايش كننده بوده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حقيقت، در اين [ماجرا] عبرتهايى است، و قطعاً ما آزمايش‌كننده بوديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همانا در این حکایت آیت و عبرتهاست و البته ما (بندگان را به این‌گونه حوادث) آزمایش کننده‌ایم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: قطعاً در این (داستان) نشانه‌هائی است (بر قدرت خدا، و در برگیرنده‌ی عبرتها و پندها برای خردمندان است) و ما به طور مسلّم (همگان را در همه‌ی قرون و اعصار به اشکال مختلف) آزمایش می‌نمائیم. [[«آیَاتٍ»: عبرتها و پندها. دلیلها و رهنمودها. «إِنْ»: قطعاً. مسلّماً. مخفّف از (إِنَّ) و از حروف مشبّهةٌ بالفعل است. «مُبْتَلِینَ»: آزمایش‌کنندگان. مراد این است که خداوند با خوشیها و ناخوشیها و به انواع و اشکال گوناگون، بندگان را می‌آزماید (نگا: بقره / 155، آل‌عمران / 186، اعراف / 168، انبیاء / 35).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان در این مایه‌های عبرتی هست و ما آزماینده بوده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آری،) در این ماجرا (برای صاحبان عقل و اندیشه) آیات و نشانه‌هایی است؛ و ما مسلّماً همگان را آزمایش می‌کنیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا در این است آیتهائی و همانا هستیم ما آزمایش‌کنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا در اين [داستان‌] نشانه‌ها و عبرتهاست و براستى ما آزمون كننده بوديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به‌راستی در این (ماجرا) بی‌چون نشانه‌هایی است. ما به‌راستی همواره آزماینده بوده‌ایم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: There were surely signs in this; We will surely put you to the test.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed, surely in this are signs and indeed surely, We were examining.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely in that are signs, and surely We put to the test.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily in that are signs; verily We have ever been provers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, in this [what We did as regards drowning of the people of Nuh (Noah)], there are indeed Ayat (proofs, evidences, lessons, signs, etc. for men to understand), for sure We are ever putting (men) to the test.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Surely in that are signs. We are always testing.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: There are great Signs in this story; and surely We do put people to test.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, in this, there are indeed Ayat, for sure We are ever putting (men) to the test.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! herein verily are portents, for lo! We are ever putting (mankind) to the test.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: There are indeed signs in this; and indeed, We have been testing.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, in that are signs, and surely We will put (nations) to the test.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed in that are signs, and indeed, We are ever testing [Our servants].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In this story there is enough evidence (of the Truth); thus do We try (mankind)

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Most surely there are signs in this, and most surely We are ever trying (men).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna fee thalika laayatin wain kunna lamubtaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Surely there are clear signs in that. In this way We put people to the test.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily in this there are Signs (for men to understand); (thus) do We try (men).

verses.text: ثُمَ‌ أَنْشَأْنَا مِنْ‌ بَعْدِهِمْ‌ قَرْناً آخَرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس بعد از آنان قومی دیگر را به وجود آوردیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و بعد از آنها مردمى ديگر بيافريديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس بعد از آنان نسل‌هايى ديگر پديد آورديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سپس، بعد از آنان نسل‌[هايى‌] ديگر پديد آورديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس از هلاک قوم نوح باز قوم دیگری ایجاد کردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس بعد از آنان، (یعنی قوم نوح)، مردمان دیگری را (به نام عاد، قوم هود) بر سر کار آوردیم. [[«قَرْناً»: مردمان یک عصر و زمان (نگا: انعام / 6). در اینجا مراد عاد، یعنی قوم هود است (نگا: اعراف / 65، هود / 50، شعراء / 124). «آخَرِینَ»: دیگران.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس، بعد از ایشان نسلی دیگر را پدید آوردیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس جمعیّت دیگری را بعد از آنها به وجود آوردیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس پدید آوردیم پس از ایشان قرنی دیگر را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس از پى آنان مردمى ديگر- قوم عاد يا ثمود- آفريديم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس، از پی آنان نسلی دیگر پدید آوردیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: After them We raised a new generation.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then after them, We created another generation.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Thereafter, after them, We produced another generation,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then, after them We brought forth anot her generation.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then, after them, We created another generation.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then, after them, We established another generation.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then, after them, We brought forth another generation;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then, after them, We created another generation.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then, after them, We brought forth another generation;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then after them We brought forth another generation,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then We produced after them another generation

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then We produced after them a generation of others.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We brought another generation into existence after the people of Noah.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then We raised up after them another generation.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma anshana min baAAdihim qarnan akhareena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then We raised another generation after them,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then We raised after them another generation.

verses.text: فَأَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِمْ‌ رَسُولاً مِنْهُمْ‌ أَنِ‌ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ‌ مَا لَکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ إِلٰهٍ‌ غَيْرُهُ‌ أَ فَلاَ تَتَّقُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و پیامبری از خودشان در میان آنان فرستادیم که خدا را بپرستید، شما را جز او معبودی نیست، آیا [از پرستش معبودان باطل] نمی پرهیزید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از خودشان به ميانشان پيامبرى فرستاديم كه: خداى يكتا را بپرستيد، شما را خدايى جز او نيست. آيا پروا نمى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و در ميانشان پيامبرى از خودشان روانه كرديم كه خدا را بپرستيد، جز او براى شما معبودى نيست. آيا پروا نمى‌كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در ميانشان پيامبرى از خودشان روانه كرديم كه: خدا را بپرستيد. جز او براى شما معبودى نيست. آيا سرِ پرهيزگارى نداريد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و در میان آن قوم باز رسولی از خودشان (یعنی هود را) فرستادیم که خدای یکتا را پرستش کنید که جز او شما را خدایی نیست، آیا خداترس و باتقوا نمی‌شوید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پیغمبری از خودشان را به میانشان روانه کردیم. (توسّط او بدیشان پیغام دادیم) که خدا را بپرستید، زیرا جز او معبودی ندارید. آیا (خویشتن را از عذاب او) می‌پرهیزید؟ [[«رَسُولاً مِّنْهُمْ»: پیغمبری از خودشان. مراد هود (علیه السلام) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه پیامبری از ایشان به میان ایشان فرستادیم [و گفتیم‌] که خداوند را بپرستید که خدایی جز او ندارید، آیا پروا نمی‌کنید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در میان آنان رسولی از خودشان فرستادیم که: «خدا را بپرستید؛ جز او معبودی برای شما نیست؛ آیا (با این همه، از شرک و بت پرستی) پرهیز نمی‌کنید؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس فرستادیم در ایشان فرستاده‌ای از ایشان که پرستش کنید خدا را نیست شما را خداوندی جز او آیا نمی‌ترسید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و در ميان آنان از خودشان پيامبرى- هود يا صالح- فرستاديم كه: خداى را بپرستيد، شما را هيچ خدايى جز او نيست. آيا پروا نمى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس در میانشان پیامبری از خودشان فرستادیم که: «خدا را بپرستید، جز او برای شما هرگز معبودی دگر نیست، پس آیا سر پرهیزگاری ندارید؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then We sent to them an apostle from among them (who said): "Worship God, for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed and fear God?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So We sent among them a Noble Messenger from among them (saying), “Worship Allah, you do not have any other God except Him; so do you not fear?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and We sent amongst them a Messenger of themselves, saying, 'Serve God! You have no god other than He. Will you not be godfearing?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then We sent amongst them an apostle from amongst themselves, saying: worship Allah, for you there is no god but he; will ye then not fear Him?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We sent to them a Messenger from among themselves (saying): "Worship Allah! You have no other Ilah (God) but Him. Will you not then be afraid (of Him i.e. of His Punishment because of worshipping others besides Him)?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We sent among them a messenger from themselves: “Serve God. You have no god other than Him. Will you not be cautious?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and We sent among them a Messenger from among themselves, saying: "Serve Allah; you have no god other than He. Do you have no fear?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We sent to them a Messenger from among themselves (saying): "Worship Allah! You have no other God but Him. Will you not then have Taqwa"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And we sent among them a messenger of their own, saying: Serve Allah, Ye have no other Allah save Him. Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and We sent them an apostle from among themselves, saying, ‘Worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. Will you not then be wary [of Him]?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and We sent to them a Messenger from themselves, saying: 'Worship Allah, for you have no god except He. Will you not be cautious'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We sent among them a messenger from themselves, [saying], "Worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We sent to them a Messenger from among their own people who told them, "Worship God; He is your only Lord. Will you then not have fear of Him?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So We sent among them an apostle from among them, saying: Serve Allah, you have no god other than Him; will you not then guard (against evil)?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faarsalna feehim rasoolan minhum ani oAAbudoo Allaha ma lakum min ilahin ghayruhu afala tattaqoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and sent a messenger to them from among themselves: "Worship God alone. You have no deity other than Him. Will you not then fear God?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We sent to them a messenger from among themselves, (saying), "Worship Allah! ye have no other god but Him. Will ye not fear (Him)?"

verses.text: وَ قَالَ‌ الْمَلَأُ مِنْ‌ قَوْمِهِ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا وَ کَذَّبُوا بِلِقَاءِ الْآخِرَةِ وَ أَتْرَفْنَاهُمْ‌ فِي‌ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا مَا هٰذَا إِلاَّ بَشَرٌ مِثْلُکُمْ‌ يَأْکُلُ‌ مِمَّا تَأْکُلُونَ‌ مِنْهُ‌ وَ يَشْرَبُ‌ مِمَّا تَشْرَبُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و از سران و اشراف قومش که کافر بودند و دیدار آخرت را تکذیب می کردند، و آنان را در زندگی دنیا از وسایل و ابزار مادی فراوانی برخوردار کرده بودیم، گفتند: این جز بشری مانند شما نیست که از آنچه شما می خورید می خورد، و از آنچه شما می آشامید می آشامد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گروهى از مهتران قومش كه كافر بودند و ديدار آخرت را دروغ مى‌شمردند و در اين دنيايشان عيش و نعمت داده بوديم، گفتند: اين مرد انسانى است همانند شما؛ از آنچه مى‌خوريد مى‌خورد و از آنچه مى‌آشاميد مى‌آشامد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اشراف قومش كه كافر شدند و ديدار آخرت را دروغ پنداشتند و در زندگى دنيا آنها را متنعّم ساخته بوديم، گفتند: اين، بشرى جز همانند شما نيست، از آنچه شما مى‌خوريد، مى‌خورد، و از آنچه مى‌نوشيد، مى‌نوشد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اشراف قومش كه كافر شده، و ديدار آخرت را دروغ پنداشته بودند، و در زندگى دنيا آنان را مرفّه ساخته بوديم گفتند: «اين [مرد] جز بشرى چون شما نيست: از آنچه مى‌خوريد، مى‌خورد؛ و از آنچه مى‌نوشيد، مى‌نوشد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و باز اشراف و اعیان قوم وی که کافر شدند و عالم آخرت را تکذیب کردند و ما متنعّمشان در حیات دنیا کرده بودیم (به مردم) گفتند که این شخص بشری مانند شما بیش نیست که از هر چه شما بشر می‌خورید و می‌آشامید او هم می‌خورد و می‌آشامد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اشراف بی‌باوری که فرا رسیدن قیامت را قبول نداشتند و در زندگی دنیا، ناز و نعمت بدیشان داده بودیم، گفتند: این انسانی همچون شما بوده (و پیغمبر نیست. چرا که) از همان چیزهائی می‌خورد که شما می‌خورید و از همان چیزهائی می‌نوشد که شما می‌نوشید. (رابط میان خدا و مردم باید فرشته باشد نه انسان!). [[«الْمَلأُ»: اشراف و بزرگان و سران قوم (نگا: بقره / 246، اعراف / 60). «لِقَآءِ الآخِرَةِ»: دیدار آخرت. «أَتْرَفْنَاهُمْ»: بدیشان اموال و اولاد و ناز و نعمت دادیم. مراد اغنیاء و اقویاء است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بزرگانی از قومش که کفرورزیده و لقای آن جهانی را انکار کرده بودند، و در زندگانی دنیا، از ناز و نعمت برخوردارشان ساخته بودیم، گفتند این [مرد] جز بشری همانند شما نیست، که از همانچه شما از آن می‌خورید، می‌خورد و از همانچه شما می‌آشامید، می‌آشامد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی اشرافیان (خودخواه) از قوم او که کافر بودند، و دیدار آخرت را تکذیب می‌کردند، و در زندگی دنیا به آنان ناز و نعمت داده بودیم، گفتند: «این بشری است مثل شما؛ از آنچه می‌خورید می‌خورد؛ و از آنچه می‌نوشید می‌نوشد! (پس چگونه می‌تواند پیامبر باشد؟!)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گفتند آن گروه از قومش که کفر ورزیدند و دروغ پنداشتند رسیدن را به آخرت و کامرائیشان دادیم در زندگانی دنیا نیست این جز بشری مانند شما می‌خورد از آنچه می‌خورید از آن و می‌نوشد از آنچه می‌نوشید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و مهتران قومش كه كافر بودند و ديدار آن جهان- يعنى رستاخيز- را باور نداشتند و آنان را در زندگى اين جهان كامرانى داده بوديم، گفتند: اين [مرد] نيست مگر آدميى همچون شما، از آنچه شما مى‌خوريد مى‌خورد و از آنچه مى‌آشاميد مى‌آشامد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اشراف قومش - که کافر شدند و دیدار آخرت را تکذیب کردند و در زندگی دنیا آنان را مرفه ساخته بودیم - گفتند: «این (مرد) جز بشری همچون شما نیست؛ از آنچه می‌خورید می‌خورد و از آنچه می‌نوشید، می‌نوشد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The chiefs of the people who did not believe and denied the life to come, though We had given them good things of this life to enjoy, (said): "He is only a mortal like you. He eats as you do, and drinks as you drink.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And said the leaders of his people, who disbelieved and denied the confronting of the Hereafter – and We had given them comfort in the worldly life – that, “He is nothing but a human like you, he eats from what you eat and drinks from what you drink.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, who cried lies to the encounter of the world to come, and to whom We had given ease in the present' life, 'This is naught but a mortal like yourselves, who eats of what you eat and drinks of what you drink.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And said the chiefs of those who disbelieved among his people and belied the meeting of the Hereafter and whom We had luxuriated in the life of the World: this is no other than a human being like unto you: he eateth of that whereof ye eat, and he drinketh of that which ye drink.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And the chiefs of his people, who disbelieved and denied the Meeting in the Hereafter, and to whom We had given the luxuries and comforts of this life, said: "He is no more than a human being like you, he eats of that which you eat, and drinks of what you drink.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But the dignitaries of his people, those who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and We had indulged them in the present life, said, “This is nothing but a human like you; he eats what you eat, and he drinks what you drink.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The notables among his people who had refused to believe and who denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and those whom We had endowed with ease and comfort in this life, cried out: "This is no other than a mortal like yourselves who eats what you eat and drinks what you drink.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And the chiefs of his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting in the Hereafter, and whom We had given the luxuries and comforts of worldly life, said: "He is no more than a human being like you, he eats of that which you eat, and drinks of what you drink."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and whom We had made soft in the life of the world, said: This is only a mortal like you, who eateth of that whereof ye eat and drinketh of that ye drink.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Said the elite of his people, who were faithless and who denied the encounter of the Hereafter and whom We had given affluence in the life of the world: ‘This is just a human being like yourselves: he eats what you eat, and drinks what you drink.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The unbelieving assembly of his nation, who belied the encounter of the Everlasting Life, and on whom We had bestowed ease in this life, said: 'This is but a human like yourselves; he eats of what you eat and drinks of what you drink.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter while We had given them luxury in the worldly life said, "This is not but a man like yourselves. He eats of that from which you eat and drinks of what you drink.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: A group of his people who disbelieved him and had called the Day of Judgment a lie and whom We had made prosperous in this life, said, "He is a mere mortal like you. He eats and drinks as you do.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the chiefs of his people who disbelieved and called the meeting of the hereafter a lie, and whom We had given plenty to enjoy in this world's life, said: This is nothing but a mortal like yourselves, eating of what you eat from and drinking of what you drink.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqala almalao min qawmihi allatheena kafaroo wakaththaboo biliqai alakhirati waatrafnahum fee alhayati alddunya ma hatha illa basharun mithlukum yakulu mimma takuloona minhu wayashrabu mimma tashraboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But the leaders of his people who denied the truth and denied the Meeting in the Hereafter, because We had granted them ease and plenty in their worldly life, said, "This is only a human being like yourselves, he eats what you eat, and drinks what you drink,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And the chiefs of his people, who disbelieved and denied the Meeting in the Hereafter, and on whom We had bestowed the good things of this life, said: "He is no more than a man like yourselves: he eats of that of which ye eat, and drinks of what ye drink.

verses.text: وَ لَئِنْ‌ أَطَعْتُمْ‌ بَشَراً مِثْلَکُمْ‌ إِنَّکُمْ‌ إِذاً لَخَاسِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بی تردید اگر بشری مانند خود را اطاعت کنید، یقیناً زیانکارید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اگر از انسانى همانند خود اطاعت كنيد، زيان كرده‌ايد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر از بشرى مثل خودتان اطاعت كنيد، البته در آن صورت زيانكاريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر بشرى مثل خودتان را اطاعت كنيد در آن صورت قطعاً زيانكار خواهيد بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و شما مردم اگر بشری مانند خود را اطاعت کنید بسیار زیانکار خواهید بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر از انسانی همسان خود پیروی کنید و بدو بگروید، در این صورت سخت زیانکار خواهید بود. [[«مِثْلَکُمْ»: همچون خود. صفت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر از بشری همانند خودتان پیروی کنید، آنگاه است که شما زیانکارید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اگر از بشری همانند خودتان اطاعت کنید، مسلّماً زیانکارید.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر فرمان برید بشری را همانند خویش شمائید در آن هنگام زیانکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
