translations.text: Or do they not recognize their Messenger, and so deny him?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or do they not recognise their Messenger, that they deny him?

verses.text: أَمْ‌ يَقُولُونَ‌ بِهِ‌ جِنَّةٌ بَلْ‌ جَاءَهُمْ‌ بِالْحَقِ‌ وَ أَکْثَرُهُمْ‌ لِلْحَقِ‌ کَارِهُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا می گویند: نوعی دیوانگی در اوست؟ [چنین نیست که این یاوه گویان به هم می بافند] بلکه او حق را برای آنان آورده است، و بیشترشان حق را خوش ندارند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا مى‌گويند كه ديوانه است؟ نه، پيامبرشان با دين حق بر آنها مبعوث شد، ولى بيشترينشان از حق كراهت دارند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: يا مى‌گويند او جنون دارد؟ نه [چنين نيست‌] بلكه او [دين‌] حق را برايشان آورده، ولى بيشترشان حقيقت را خوش ندارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا مى‌گويند او جنونى دارد؟ [نه،] بلكه [او] حق را براى ايشان آورده و[لى‌] بيشترشان حقيقت را خوش ندارند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا آنکه می‌گویند که این رسول را جنونی عارض شده (که دعوی رسالت می‌کند)؟ (چنین نیست) بلکه دین حق را بر آنها آورده و لیکن اکثر آنها از حق روگردان و متنفرند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که خواهند گفت: او دیوانه است؟ (چنین نیست که می‌انگارند) بلکه او حق را برای آنان آورده است (و سخنانش سراسر حقیقت است. ولی عیب کار اینجا است که) بیشتر ایشان از حق بیزار (و دشمن حقیقت) می‌باشند. [[«جِنَّةٌ»: جنون. دیوانگی (نگا: اعراف / 184، مؤمنون / 25). «الْحَقِّ»: حقیقت. مراد قرآن (نگا: مائده / 48 و 84) یا شریعت است (نگا: قصص / 48، عنکبوت / 68).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا می‌گویند او جنونی دارد، [چنین نیست‌] بلکه [پیامبر] حق را برای آنان آورده است، و بیشترینه آنان ناخواهان حق‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا می‌گویند او دیوانه است؟! ولی او حق را برای آنان آورده؛ امّا بیشترشان از حق کراهت دارند (و گریزانند).

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا گویند بدو آشفتگی است بلکه بیامدشان به حقّ و بیشتر ایشانند حقّ را ناخوش‌دارندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مى‌گويند او را ديوانگى است؟ [نه،] بلكه به حق- با سخن راست يعنى قرآن يا دين درست يعنى اسلام- بديشان آمده، و بيشترشان حق را خوش ندارند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا می‌گویند در او جنونی است‌؟ (نه!) بلکه او تمامی حق را برای ایشان آورده حال آنکه بیشترشان حق را بسی ناپسند می‌دارند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do they say that he is possessed? In fact, he has brought the truth to them, but most of them abhor the truth.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or they say, “He is afflicted by a demon”; in fact he brought the Truth to them, and most of them dislike the Truth.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or do they say, 'He is bedevilled'? Nay, he has brought them the truth, but most of them are averse from the truth.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or, say they: in him is madness? O Aye he brought them the truth, and most of them to the truth are averse.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or say they: "There is madness in him?" Nay, but he brought them the truth [i.e. "(A) Tauhid: Worshipping Allah Alone in all aspects (B) The Quran (C) The religion of Islam,"] but most of them (the disbelievers) are averse to the truth.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they say, “He is possessed?” In fact, he brought them the truth, but most of them hate the truth.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or do they say that there is madness in him? Nay, he has brought them the Truth and it is the Truth that most of them disdain.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or they say: There is madness in him Nay, but he brought them the truth, but most of them are averse to the truth.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or say they: There is a madness in him? Nay, but he bringeth them the Truth; and most of them are haters of the Truth.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they say, ‘There is madness in him’? No, he has brought them the truth, and most of them are averse to the truth.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do they say he is mad! No, he came to them with the truth, but most of them hate the truth.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do they say, "In him is madness?" Rather, he brought them the truth, but most of them, to the truth, are averse.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: or you said that he is possessed by satan? In fact, he has brought you the truth, but most of you dislike it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or do they say: There is madness in him? Nay! he has brought them the truth, and most of them are averse from the truth.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am yaqooloona bihi jinnatun bal jaahum bialhaqqi waaktharuhum lilhaqqi karihoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they say he is possessed? Rather he has brought them the truth, but most of them are averse to the truth.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or do they say, "He is possessed"? Nay, he has brought them the Truth, but most of them hate the Truth.

verses.text: وَ لَوِ اتَّبَعَ‌ الْحَقُ‌ أَهْوَاءَهُمْ‌ لَفَسَدَتِ‌ السَّمَاوَاتُ‌ وَ الْأَرْضُ‌ وَ مَنْ‌ فِيهِنَ‌ بَلْ‌ أَتَيْنَاهُمْ‌ بِذِکْرِهِمْ‌ فَهُمْ‌ عَنْ‌ ذِکْرِهِمْ‌ مُعْرِضُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر حق از هواهای نفس آنان پیروی می کرد، بی تردید آسمان ها و زمین و هر که در آنهاست از هم می پاشید [و تباه می شد؛ چنین نیست که حق از هواهای نفس آنان پیروی کند] بلکه کتاب [ی را که مایه شرف و سربلندی] آنان [است] به آنان داده ایم، ولی آنان از مایه شرف و سربلندی خود روی گردانند.،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر حق از پى هوسهايشان مى‌رفت، آسمانها و زمين و هر كه در آنهاست تباه مى‌شد. ولى ما اندرزشان فرستاديم و آنها از اندرزشان رويگردان شدند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر حق از هوس‌هاى آنها پيروى مى‌كرد، قطعا آسمان‌ها و زمين و هر كه در آنهاست تباه مى‌شد، ولى ما پندنامه‌شان (قرآن) را بديشان داديم اما آنها از [آنچه مايه‌] يادآوريشان است رويگردانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر حق از هوسهاى آنها پيروى مى‌كرد، قطعاً آسمانها و زمين و هر كه در آنهاست تباه مى‌شد. [نه!] بلكه يادنامه‌شان را به آنان داده‌ايم، ولى آنها از [پيروى‌] يادنامه خود رويگردانند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اگر حق تابع هوای نفس آنان شود همانا آسمانها و زمین و هر که در آنهاست فاسد خواهد شد. (و کافران از جهل نسبت جنون به رسول ما دادند؛ چنین نیست) بلکه ما اندرز قرآن بزرگ را بر آنها فرستادیم و آنان از این اندرز خود اعراض کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر حق و حقیقت از خواستها و هوسهای ایشان پیروی می‌کرد (و جهان هستی بر طبق تمایلاتشان به گردش می‌افتاد) آسمانها و زمین و همه‌ی کسانی که در آنها بسر می‌برند تباه می‌گردیدند (و نظم و نظام کائنات از هم می‌پاشید). ما قرآن را به آنان داده‌ایم که در آن (موجبات) آوازه‌ی ایشان است، ولی آنان از (چیزی که مایه‌ی) عزّت و آبرویشان (است) رویگردانند (و انگار راه بیداری و خوشبختی خود را نمی‌دانند). [[«الْحَقُّ»: خدا (نگا: نور / 25). یعنی اگر خدا برابر خواست مردم به ویژه کفّار رفتار کند، هرج و مرج سراسر جهان را فرا می‌گیرد و ... حقیقت. آنچه صحیح و درست است و مقابل باطل قرار دارد. «ذِکْر»: قرآن. (نگا: آل‌عمران / 58، حجر / 6 و 9). شهرت و افتخار و نام و آوازه (نگا: انبیاء / 10، زخرف / 44). چرا که قرآن به زبان عربها بوده و ملّتها مادام که زبانشان برجا است، ایشان ماندگارند. غیر از این، قرآن عربها را به جهان شناساند و آنان را زنده نگاه داشت و از نوکری به سَروری رساند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر حق از هوی و هوسهای آنان پیروی می‌کرد، بی‌شک آسمان و زمین و هر که در آنهاست، تباه می‌شد، حق این است که حدیث خودشان را برایشان آورده‌ایم، آنگاه آنان از یاد خویش رویگردانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اگر حق از هوسهای آنها پیروی کند، آسمانها و زمین و همه کسانی که در آنها هستند تباه می‌شوند! ولی ما قرآنی به آنها دادیم که مایه یادآوری (و عزّت و شرف) برای آنهاست، امّا آنان از (آنچه مایه) یادآوریشان (است) رویگردانند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر پیروی کند حقّ هوسهای آنان را هر آینه فاسد شود آسمانها و زمین و هر که در آنها است بلکه آوردیمشان به ذکر خود پس ایشانند از ذکر خود روی‌گردانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اگر حق از هوسها و آرزوهاى آنان پيروى مى‌كرد هر آينه آسمانها و زمين و هر كه در آنهاست تباه مى‌شد، ولى ما يادكرد و پندشان- قرآن- را بديشان آورديم و آنها از ياد و پند خويش رويگردانند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اگر حق (بر فرض محال) از هوس‌های آنان پیروی می‌کرد، بی‌گمان آسمان‌ها و زمین و آنان که در آنهایند تباه می‌شدند. بلکه یادنامه‌شان را به ایشان دادیم. پس آنها از (پیروی) یادنامه‌ی خود رویگردانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Had truth been subject to their whims the heavens and the earth and all those within them would have been depraved. In fact We had sent them their reminder, but they turned away from good advice.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And had the Truth followed their desires, then indeed the heavens and the earth and all those who are in them would be destroyed; in fact We brought to them a thing in which lay their repute, so they are turned away from their own repute.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Had the truth followed their caprices, the heavens and the earth and whosoever in them is had surely corrupted. Nay, We brought them their Remembrance, but from their Remembrance they turned.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And were the truth to follow their desires there would have been corrupted the heavens and the earth and whatsoever is therein. Aye! We have come to them with their admonition; so it is from their admonition that they turn away.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And if the truth had been in accordance with their desires, verily, the heavens and the earth, and whosoever is therein would have been corrupted! Nay, We have brought them their reminder, but they turn away from their reminder.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: If the truth conformed to their desires, the heavens, the earth, and everyone in them would have gone to ruin. In fact, We have given them their message, but they keep avoiding their message.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Were the Truth to follow their desires, the order of the heavens and the earth and those who dwell in them would have been ruined. Nay, the fact is that We have brought to them their own remembrance; and yet it is from their own remembrance that they are turning away.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And if Al-Haqq had followed their desires, verily, the heavens and the earth, and whosoever is therein would have been corrupted! Nay, We have brought them their reminder, but they turn away from their reminder.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And if the Truth had followed their desires, verily the heavens and the earth and whosoever is therein had been corrupted. Nay, We have brought them their Reminder, but from their Reminder they now turn away.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Had the truth followed their desires, the heavens and the earth would have surely fallen apart [along] with those who are in them. Indeed, We have brought them their Reminder, but they are disregardful of their Reminder.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Had the truth followed their fancies, the heavens, the earth, and all who live in them would have surely been corrupted. No, We brought them theirRemembrance; but from their Remembrance they turn away.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But if the Truth had followed their inclinations, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message, but they, from their message, are turning away.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Had the truth followed their desires, the heavens and the earth and all that is in them would have been destroyed. We sent them the Quran but they ignored it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And should the truth follow their low desires, surely the heavens and the earth and all those who are therein would have perished. Nay! We have brought to them their reminder, but from their reminder they turn aside.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walawi ittabaAAa alhaqqu ahwaahum lafasadati alssamawatu waalardu waman feehinna bal ataynahum bithikrihim fahum AAan thikrihim muAAridoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: If truth had followed their whims and desires, heavens and earth and all that lives in them would have been brought to ruin. Rather We have brought them their Reminder. Yet they keep avoiding their Reminder.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: If the Truth had been in accord with their desires, truly the heavens and the earth, and all beings therein would have been in confusion and corruption! Nay, We have sent them their admonition, but they turn away from their admonition.

verses.text: أَمْ‌ تَسْأَلُهُمْ‌ خَرْجاً فَخَرَاجُ‌ رَبِّکَ‌ خَيْرٌ وَ هُوَ خَيْرُ الرَّازِقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا [مگر برای ادای وظیفه ات] مزدی از آنان می خواهی [که پذیرش دعوتت برای آنان سنگین است؟] پس مزد پروردگارت بهتر است، و او بهترین روزی دهندگان است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا تو از آنها مزدى مى‌طلبى؟ مزد پروردگارت بهتر است، كه او بهترين روزى‌دهندگان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا از ايشان مزدى مى‌خواهى؟ ولى مزد پروردگارت بهتر است كه بهترين روزى دهندگان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا از ايشان مزدى مطالبه مى‌كنى؟ و مزد پروردگارت بهتر است، و اوست كه بهترين روزى‌دهندگان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: مگر تو از این امت خرج و مزد رسالت می‌خواهی؟ (هرگز!) مزدی که خدا به تو دهد (از هر چیز) بهتر است، که خدا بهترین روزی دهنده است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا (بهانه‌ی فرار ایشان از حق این است که) تو از آنان اجر و مزدی (در برابر دعوت و ادای رسالت) طلب می‌کنی؟ (نه! چنین کاری را نکرده و نمی‌کنی. چرا که) اجر و مزد پروردگارت بهتر است (از چیزی که ایشان دارند) و او بهترین روزی‌رسان است. [[«خَرْجاً»: اجر و مزد. هزینه (نگا: کهف / 94). «خَرَاج»: اجر و مزد. هزینه. «خَیْرُ الرَّازِقِینَ»: بهترینِ روزی‌رسانان. بهترینِ دهندگان (نگا: مائده / 114، حجّ / 58).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا شاید از آنان مزدی می‌طلبی؟ ولی پاداش پروردگارت [بسی‌] بهتر است، و او بهترین روزی‌دهندگان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا اینکه تو از آنها مزد و هزینه‌ای (در برابر دعوتت) می‌خواهی؟ با اینکه مزد پروردگارت بهتر، و او بهترین روزی دهندگان است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا پرسیشان هزینه پس هزینه پروردگار تو بهتر است و او است بهترین روزی‌دهندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر از آنان مزدى مى‌خواهى؟! و حال آنكه مزد- خير و پاداش و روزى- پروردگارت بهتر است و او بهترين روزى‌دهندگان است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا از ایشان هزینه‌ای مطالبه می‌کنی؟ پس خراج و رحمت پروردگارت بهتر است. و اوست که بهترین روزی‌دهندگان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do you ask of them any tribute? In that case the tribute of your Lord is better, for He is the best of providers.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Do you (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) ask any fee from them? So the reward of your Lord is the best; and He is the Best Provider of Sustenance.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or dost thou ask them for tribute? Yet the tribute of thy Lord is better, and He is the best of providers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or, is it that thou askest of them any maintenance? The maintenance of thy Lord is better, and He is the Best of providers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or is it that you (O Muhammad SAW) ask them for some wages? But the recompense of your Lord is better, and He is the Best of those who give sustenance.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or are you asking them for a payment? The revenue from your Lord is better, and He is the Best of providers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Are you asking them for something? What Allah has given you is the best. He is the Best of providers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or is it that you ask them for some Kharj But the recompense of your Lord is better, and He is the Best of those who give sustenance.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or dost thou ask of them (O Muhammad) any tribute? But the bounty of thy Lord is better, for He is Best of all who make provision.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do you ask a recompense from them? Your Lord’s recompense is better, and He is the best of providers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, do you ask a tribute from them? Your Lord's tribute is better. He is the Best of providers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask them for payment? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the best of providers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Do they disbelieve because) you asked them for payment? The reward that you will receive from your Lord is the best. He is the best Provider.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or is it that you ask them a recompense? But the recompense of your Lord is best, and He is the best of those who provide sustenance.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am tasaluhum kharjan fakharaju rabbika khayrun wahuwa khayru alrraziqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Or are you asking them for any reward? But the reward of your Lord is the best, for He is the Best of Providers,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or is it that thou askest them for some recompense? But the recompense of thy Lord is best: He is the Best of those who give sustenance.

verses.text: وَ إِنَّکَ‌ لَتَدْعُوهُمْ‌ إِلَى‌ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و مسلماً تو آنان را به راهی راست دعوت می کنی،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه تو به راه راستشان مى‌خوانى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به راستى تو حقا آنها را به راه راست مى‌خوانى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در حقيقت، اين تويى كه جدّاً آنها را به راه راست مى‌خوانى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و البته تو خلق را به راه راست می‌خوانی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو (ای پیغمبر!) آنان را به راه راست فرا می‌خوانی (که دین اسلام و منتهی به سعادت است).

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و تو ایشان را به راهی راست می‌خوانی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بطور قطع و یقین، تو آنان را به راه راست دعوت می‌کنی.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا تو خوانیشان بسوی راهی راست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه تو آنان را به راه راست مى‌خوانى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان تو اینان را به راهی بس راست می‌خوانی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You are surely calling them to the right path.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed you call them to the Straight Path.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Assuredly thou art calling them to a straight path;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily thou! thou callest them unto a Path straight.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And certainly, you (O Muhammad SAW) call them to a Straight Path (true religion Islamic Monotheism).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: You are inviting them to a straight path.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: You are calling them to a Straight Way,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And certainly, you call them to the straight path.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! thou summonest them indeed unto a straight path.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed you invite them to a straight path,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed you are calling them to a Straight Path,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), you certainly have called them to the right path,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely you invite them to a right way.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainnaka latadAAoohum ila siratin mustaqeemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and, most surely, you are calling them to a straight path.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But verily thou callest them to the Straight Way;

verses.text: وَ إِنَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ لاَ يُؤْمِنُونَ‌ بِالْآخِرَةِ عَنِ‌ الصِّرَاطِ لَنَاکِبُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بی تردید کسانی که به آخرت ایمان نمی آورند از [این] راه منحرف اند. ….

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و كسانى كه به آخرت ايمان ندارند از راه راست منحرفند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و كسانى كه به آخرت ايمان ندارند، حتما از راه [درست‌] منحرف‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به راستى كسانى كه به آخرت ايمان ندارند، از راه [درست‌] سخت منحرفند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و لیکن آنان که به آخرت ایمان نمی‌آورند از آن راه راست برمی‌گردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کسانی که به آخرت ایمان ندارند، از راه (راست) منحرف هستند. [[«نَاکِبُونَ»: منحرفان از مسیر.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و کسانی که به آخرت ایمان نمی‌آورند، از راه [راست‌] به در افتاده‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا کسانی که به آخرت ایمان ندارند از این راه منحرفند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا آنان که ایمان نمی‌آرند به آخرت از راهند کناره‌گیران (کجروان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنان كه به جهان واپسين ايمان نمى‌آورند همانا از راه راست بگرديده‌اند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌چون کسانی که به آخرت ایمان ندارند، از (این) راه (راست) سخت منحرفند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But those who believe not in the Hereafter turn away from the straight path.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviated from the Straight Path.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and surely they that believe not in the world to come are deviating from the path.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily those who believe not in the Hereafter are from the path deviating.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter are indeed deviating far astray from the Path (true religion Islamic Monotheism).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But those who do not believe in the Hereafter are swerving from the path.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: but those who do not believe in the Hereafter are ever prone to deviate from the Right Way.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter are indeed deviating far astray from the path.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! those who believe not in the Hereafter are indeed astray from the path.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and those who do not believe in the Hereafter surely deviate from the path.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: but those who disbelieve in the Everlasting Life deviate from the Path.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: but those who disbelieve the life hereafter deviate from the right path.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely those who do not believe in the hereafter are deviating from the way.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna allatheena la yuminoona bialakhirati AAani alssirati lanakiboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But those who do not believe in the Hereafter have indeed deviated from that path.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And verily those who believe not in the Hereafter are deviating from that Way.

verses.text: وَ لَوْ رَحِمْنَاهُمْ‌ وَ کَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِمْ‌ مِنْ‌ ضُرٍّ لَلَجُّوا فِي‌ طُغْيَانِهِمْ‌ يَعْمَهُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر به آنان رحم کنیم و آسیب و گزندی را که دچار آن هستند [از آنان] برطرف سازیم، باز هم سرگردان و متحیر در سرکشی و طغیانشان لجاجت می ورزند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر بر آنها رحمت مى‌آورديم و آزارى را كه بدان گرفتارند از آنها دور مى‌ساختيم، باز هم همچنان با سرسختى در طغيان خويش سرگشته مى‌ماندند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر به آنها رحم كنيم و بلايى كه بدان گرفتارند از ايشان برطرف سازيم، باز در طغيان خود، سرگشته لجاجت مى‌ورزند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر ايشان را ببخشاييم، و آنچه از صدمه بر آنان [وارد آمده‌] است برطرف كنيم، در طغيان خود كوردلانه اصرار مى‌ورزند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اگر ما با آنها مهربانی کرده و هر گونه الم و رنج و عذابی که دارند برطرف سازیم آنها سخت‌تر در طغیان و سرکشی خود فرو می‌روند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر بدیشان رحم کنیم و بلاها و گرفتاریهای گریبانگیرشان را برطرف سازیم، در طغیان و سرکشی خود مصرّانه و سرگردان دست‌وپا می‌زنند. [[«ضُرٍّ»: (نگا: انعام / 17، یونس / 12 و 107). «یَعْمَهُونَ»: (نگا: بقره / 15، انعام / 110، اعراف / 186).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر بر آنان رحمت می‌آوردیم و بلایی را که دچارش بودند، می‌گرداندیم، در طغیانشان با سرگشتگی پای می‌فشردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اگر به آنان رحم کنید و گرفتاریها و مشکلاتشان را برطرف سازیم، (نه تنها بیدار نمی‌شوند، بلکه) در طغیانشان لجاجت می‌ورزند و (در این وادی) سرگردان می‌مانند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر رحم کنیم ایشان را و بگشائیم آنچه بدیشان است از رنج همانا خیرگی کنند در سرکشی خود فروروندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اگر بر آنها مِهر آوريم و گزندى را كه به آنها رسيده برداريم هر آينه سرگشته و كوردل در سركشى خويش بستيزند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اگر ایشان را رحم کنیم و آنچه زیان در خود دارند (زدوده و) برگشاییم، بی‌گمان در طغیانشان در حال سرگردانی لجاجت می‌کنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: If We took compassion on them and removed the affliction they are in, they would only wander lost in confusion.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And if We have mercy upon them and remove the calamity which has befallen them, they would still stubbornly persist, wandering in their rebellion.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Did We have mercy on them, and remove the affliction that is upon them, they would persist in their insolence wandering blindly.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And though We have mercy on them We may remove whatsoever of hurt is with them, surely they would persist in their exorbitance, wandering perplexed.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And though We had mercy on them and removed the distress which is on them, still they would obstinately persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Even if We had mercy on them, and relieved their problems, they would still blindly persist in their defiance.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Were We to be merciful to them and remove from them their present afflictions, they would persist in their transgression, blindly wandering on.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And though We had mercy on them and removed the distress which is on them, still they would obstinately persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Though We had mercy on them and relieved them of the harm afflicting them, they still would wander blindly on in their contumacy.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Should We have mercy upon them and remove their distress, they would surely persist, bewildered in their rebellion.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: If We had mercy on them and removed their afflictions, they would still persist in their insolence, blindly wandering.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And even if We gave them mercy and removed what was upon them of affliction, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Even if We were to grant them mercy and rescue them from hardship, they would still blindly persist in their rebellion.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And if We show mercy to them and remove the distress they have, they would persist in their inordinacy, blindly wandering on.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaw rahimnahum wakashafna ma bihim min durrin lalajjoo fee tughyanihim yaAAmahoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Even if We showed them mercy and relieved them of their afflictions, they would still persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: If We had mercy on them and removed the distress which is on them, they would obstinately persist in their transgression, wandering in distraction to and fro.

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ أَخَذْنَاهُمْ‌ بِالْعَذَابِ‌ فَمَا اسْتَکَانُوا لِرَبِّهِمْ‌ وَ مَا يَتَضَرَّعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همانا ما آنان را به بلاها و آسیب ها [ی دنیایی] گرفتیم، ولی نه برای پروردگارشان فروتنی کردند و نه به پیشگاهش زاری می کنند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به عذاب گرفتارشان كرديم. پس در مقابل پروردگارشان نه فروتنى كردند و نه تضرع.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به راستى ايشان را گرفتار عذاب كرديم [تا بيدار شوند]، ولى در مقابل پروردگارشان، نه فروتنى كردند، و نه تضرّع مى‌كردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به راستى ايشان را به عذاب گرفتار كرديم و[لى‌] نسبت به پروردگارشان فروتنى نكردند و به زارى درنيامدند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همانا ما آنها را به عذاب سخت گرفتار کردیم و باز آن کافران به تضرع و توبه و ناله رو به درگاه خدای خود نیاوردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (اگر هم از طریق رحمت و نعمت بیدار نشدند) ما ایشان را به عذاب (مصائب و شدائدی همچون قحط و فقر) گرفتار می‌سازیم، امّا آنان در برابر پروردگارشان نه سر فرود می‌آورند و کرنش می‌برند، و نه تضرّع و زاری می‌کنند. (لذا حوادث دردناک هم ایشان را از مرکب غرور و سرکشی و خودکامگی پائین نمی‌آورد و در برابر جلال حق تسلیم و خاشع نمی‌گرداند). [[«مَا اسْتَکانُوا»: از ماده (کون) یعنی: حال به حال نشدند و دگرگون نگشتند (نگا: المصحف المیسّر). از ماده (کین) یعنی: خواری و کوچکی ننمودند و خشوع و خضوع نکردند (نگا: آل‌عمران / 146).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی آنان را با عذاب فرو گرفتیم، و در برابر پروردگارشان خاکساری و زاری نکردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما آنها را به عذاب و بلا گرفتار ساختیم (تا بیدار شوند)، امّا آنان نه در برابر پروردگارشان تواضع کردند، و نه به درگاهش تضرّع می‌کنند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا گرفتیمشان به عذاب پس فروتن نشدند برای پروردگار خویش و نه زاری کنند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه به عذاب بگرفتيمشان، اما پروردگارشان را فروتنى نكردند و زارى ننمودند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان ایشان را بی‌چون به عذاب گرفتار کردیم. پس نسبت به پروردگارشان فروتنی نکردند و همی زاری (و خاکساری) نمی‌کنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We had seized them with the punishment, but they did not bow before their Lord nor turned to Him in humility,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed We grasped them with punishment, so neither did they submit themselves to their Lord, nor do they cry humbly.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We already seized them with the chastisement, yet they abased not themselves to their Lord nor were they humble;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly We took hold of them with the torment, yet they humbled not themselves to their Lord, nor did they entreat.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed We seized them with punishment, but they humbled not themselves to their Lord, nor did they invoke (Allah) with submission to Him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We have already gripped them with suffering, but they did not surrender to their Lord, nor did they humble themselves.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (They are such) that We seized them with chastisement (and yet) they did not humble themselves before their Lord, nor do they entreat

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed We seized them with punishment, but they humbled not themselves to their Lord, nor did they invoke with submission to Him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Already have We grasped them with punishment, but they humble not themselves unto their Lord, nor do they pray,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We have already seized them with punishment, yet they did not humble themselves before their Lord, nor will they entreat [Him for mercy]

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Already We have seized them with the punishment, but they neither humbled themselves to their Lord, nor did they beseech Him,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We had gripped them with suffering [as a warning], but they did not yield to their Lord, nor did they humbly supplicate, [and will continue thus]

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We struck them with torment, but they did not submit themselves to their Lord, nor did they make themselves humble

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And already We overtook them with chastisement, but they were not submissive to their Lord, nor do they humble themselves.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad akhathnahum bialAAathabi fama istakanoo lirabbihim wama yatadarraAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We seized them with the punishment, but they did not surrender to their Lord, nor will they humble themselves

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We inflicted Punishment on them, but they humbled not themselves to their Lord, nor do they submissively entreat (Him)!-

verses.text: حَتَّى‌ إِذَا فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ‌ بَاباً ذَا عَذَابٍ‌ شَدِيدٍ إِذَا هُمْ‌ فِيهِ‌ مُبْلِسُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: تا هنگامی که دری از عذابی سخت به روی آنان بگشاییم، ناگهان در آن حال از همه چیز مأیوس و نومید می شوند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تا آنگاه كه درى از عذاب سخت بر رويشان گشوديم، چنان كه از همه جا نوميد گشتند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تا وقتى كه درى از عذاب سخت به رويشان مى‌گشاييم، كه به ناگاه از همه جا قطع اميد كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا وقتى كه درى از عذاب دردناك بر آنان گشوديم، بناگاه ايشان در آن [حال‌] نوميد شدند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تا آنکه بر آنها دری از بلا و عذاب سخت گشودیم که دیگر ناگاه در آن عذاب (از هر سو) نومید شدند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (این وضع، یعنی آزمونهای رحمت و نعمت، و بلا و محنت برای بیداری ادامه می‌یابد، و ایشان هم بر گردنکشی و سرکشی خود می‌افزایند) تا دری از عذاب شدید (روز قیامت) را به رویشان می‌گشائیم و به ناگاه در آن درمانده و ناامید (از نجات) می‌گردند. (بدین ترتیب مراحل آزمون لطف و مهربانی، و گوشمالی و کیفر تربیتی، سپری می‌شود، و سرانجام عذاب ابدی و درماندگی همیشگی سر می‌رسد). [[«بَاباً ذَا عَذَابٍ»: دری از عذاب. مراد مجازات روز قیامت و عذاب دوزخ است (نگا: زخرف / 74 و 75). «مُبْلِسُونَ»: ماتم‌زدگان و متحیّران و ناامیدان از نجات (نگا: روم / 12 و 49).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تا آنکه بر آنان دری از عذاب سخت گشودیم، آنگاه بود که نومید شدند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (این وضع همچنان ادامه می‌یابد) تا زمانی که دری از عذاب شدید به روی آنان بگشاییم، (و چنان گرفتار می‌شوند که) ناگهان بکلّی مأیوس گردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا گاهی که برگشودیم بر ایشان دری را دارای عذابی سخت ناگهان ایشانند در آن سراسیمه یا نومیدان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تا هنگامى كه درى از عذاب سخت بر آنها بگشوديم، آنگاه در آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: تا هنگامی که دری - دارای عذابی سخت - بر آنان گشودیم. ناگهان ایشان در آن (حال) نومید و بسی اندوهگینند‌.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So that when at last We open up the gate of severe punishment on them they will be overwhelmed with despair.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: To the extent that when We opened the gate of a severe punishment for them, they thereupon lie despairingly in it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: until, when We open against them a door of terrible chastisement, lo, they are sore confounded at it.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Until when we shall open upon them a portal of severe torment, and lo! thereat they are desparing

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Until, when We open for them the gate of severe punishment, then lo! They will be plunged into destruction with deep regrets, sorrows and in despair.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Until, when We have opened before them a gate of intense agony, at once they will despair.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: until We opened upon them the door of a severe chastisement. Then lo, in this state they become utterly despaired of any good.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Until, when We open for them the gate of severe punishment, then lo! they will be plunged in despair.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Until, when We open for them the gate of extreme punishment, behold! they are aghast thereat.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: until We open on them the gate of a severe punishment, whereupon they will be despondent in it.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: when We opened on them a gate of severe punishment, they utterly despaired.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Until when We have opened before them a door of severe punishment, immediately they will be therein in despair.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: until We opened the gate of greater torment (death) and they suddenly found themselves in despair.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Until when We open upon them a door of severe chastisement, lo! they are in despair at it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Hatta itha fatahna AAalayhim baban tha AAathabin shadeedin itha hum feehi mublisoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: until We open before them a gate of harsh punishment and then they will be dumbfounded.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Until We open on them a gate leading to a severe Punishment: then Lo! they will be plunged in despair therein!

verses.text: وَ هُوَ الَّذِي‌ أَنْشَأَ لَکُمُ‌ السَّمْعَ‌ وَ الْأَبْصَارَ وَ الْأَفْئِدَةَ قَلِيلاً مَا تَشْکُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اوست که برای شما گوش و دیده و دل پدید آورد، ولی اندکی سپاس گزاری می کنید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اوست آن خدايى كه برايتان گوش و چشم و دل بيافريد. چه اندك سپاس مى‌گزاريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اوست [خدايى‌] كه براى شما گوش و چشم و دل پديد آورد، امّا كمتر سپاسگزارى مى‌كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اوست آن كس كه براى شما گوش و چشم و دل پديد آورد. چه اندك سپاسگزاريد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اوست خدایی که برای شما گوش و چشمها و قلبها آفرید (ولی) عده بسیار کمی از شما شکر او به جای می‌آورید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خدا کسی است که برای شما گوش و چشم و عقل را آفریده است (تا صداها را بشنوید و جهان را ببینید و خالق آن را درک کنید، و در نتیجه ایمان بیاورید). امّا کمتر شکر و سپاس (این آفریده‌های خدا) را به جای می‌آورید. [[«الأفْئِدَة»: جمع فُؤاد، دل. در اینجا مراد عقل و خرد است. «قَلِیلاً مَّا»: واژه (قَلیلاً) صفت مصدر محذوف یا مفعول مطلق است، و کلمه (ما) زائد و برای تأکید است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و او کسی است که برای شما گوش [ها] و چشم [ها] و قلب [ها] آفرید، چه اندکمایه سپاس می‌گزارید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و او کسی است که برای شما گوش و چشم و قلب [=عقل‌] ایجاد کرد؛ امّا کمتر شکر او را بجا می‌آورید.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و او است آنکه پدید آورد برای شما گوش و دیده‌گان و دلها را به کمی سپاسگزارید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اوست كه براى شما گوش و ديدگان و دلها بيافريد، [و شما] اندكى سپاس مى‌گزاريد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اوست کسی که برای شما گوش‌ها و چشم‌ها و دل‌های فروزان پدید آورد. (پس چه) اندکی سپاس می‌گزارید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is He who gave you hearing, sight, and hearts, but only few of you give thanks.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And it is He Who has created ears and eyes and hearts for you; very little is the right you acknowledge.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It is He who produced for you hearing, and eyes, and hearts; little thanks you show.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And He it is Who brought forth for you hearing and sight and hearts, little thanks ye give!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: It is He, Who has created for you (the sense of) hearing (ears), sight (eyes), and hearts (understanding). Little thanks you give.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is He who produced for you the hearing, and the eyesight, and the feelings. But little gratitude you show.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It is He Who has endowed you with the faculties of hearing and sight and has given you hearts (to think). Scarcely do you give thanks.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: It is He Who has created for you hearing, eyes, and hearts. Little thanks you give.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He it is Who hath created for you ears and eyes and hearts. Small thanks give ye!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is He who made for you hearing, eyesight, and hearts. Little do you thank.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It was He who produced for you hearing, eyes, and hearts, yet little is that you thank.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is God who has created ears, eyes, and hearts for you. Little are the thanks that you give.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And He it is Who made for you the ears and the eyes and the hearts; little is it that you give thanks.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wahuwa allathee anshaa lakumu alssamAAa waalabsara waalafidata qaleelan ma tashkuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It is He who gave you ears, eyes and hearts, yet how seldom you are grateful!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: It is He Who has created for you (the faculties of) hearing, sight, feeling and understanding: little thanks it is ye give!

verses.text: وَ هُوَ الَّذِي‌ ذَرَأَکُمْ‌ فِي‌ الْأَرْضِ‌ وَ إِلَيْهِ‌ تُحْشَرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اوست که شما را در زمین آفرید و عاقبت به سوی او گردآوری می شوید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اوست آن خدايى كه شما را در روى زمين پديد آورد و همه نزد او گرد آورده مى‌شويد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اوست كه شما را در زمين پديد آورد و به سوى او محشور مى‌شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اوست آن كس كه شما را در زمين پديد آورد، و به سوى اوست كه گرد آورده خواهيد شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اوست خدایی که شما را در زمین پدید آورد و باز (روز قیامت) رجوع و حشر شما به سوی او خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او کسی است که در زمین شما را آفریده‌است و در آن افزون و پراکنده نموده است و (روز قیامت برای سزا و جزا) در پیشگاه او گرد آورده می‌شوید. [[«ذَرَأَ»: آفریده است و افزون و پراکنده نموده است (نگا: انعام / 136، اعراف / 179). «إِلَیْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ»: در پیشگاه او جمع آورده می‌شوید. به پیشگاه او برگردانده می‌شوید (نگا: بقره / 203، آل‌عمران / 12 و 158).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و او کسی است که شما را در زمین پدید آورد و نزد او محشور می‌شوید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و او کسی است که شما را در زمین آفرید؛ و به سوی او محشور می‌شوید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و او است آنکه آفرید شما را از زمین و بسوی او گردآورده شوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اوست كه شما را در زمين پديد كرد و [سرانجام‌] به سوى او برانگيخته و فراهم مى‌شويد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اوست کسی که شما را در زمین نمایان کرد و تنها سوی اوست که گردآورده خواهید شد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is He who multiplied you on the earth, and it will be before Him that you will be gathered.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And it is He Who has spread you in the earth, and towards Him you are to be raised.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It is He who scattered you in the earth, and to Him you shall be mustered.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And He it is Who spread you on the earth, and unto Him ye will be gathered.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And it is He Who has created you on the earth, and to Him you shall be gathered back.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And it is He who multiplied you on earth, and to Him you will be gathered.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It is He Who has dispersed you all around the earth, and it is unto Him that you shall all be mustered.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And it is He Who has created you on the earth, and to Him you shall be gathered back.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And He it is Who hath sown you broadcast in the earth, and unto Him ye will be gathered.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is He who created you on the earth, and you will be mustered toward Him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It was He who scattered you on the earth, and before Him you shall be gathered.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is God who has settled you on the earth and before Him you will all be assembled.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And He it is Who multiplied you in the earth, and to Him you shall be gathered.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wahuwa allathee tharaakum fee alardi wailayhi tuhsharoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He it is who has multiplied you on the earth and to Him you shall all be gathered:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And He has multiplied you through the earth, and to Him shall ye be gathered back.

verses.text: وَ هُوَ الَّذِي‌ يُحْيِي‌ وَ يُمِيتُ‌ وَ لَهُ‌ اخْتِلاَفُ‌ اللَّيْلِ‌ وَ النَّهَارِ أَ فَلاَ تَعْقِلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اوست که حیات می دهد و می میراند و رفت و آمد شب و روز در سیطره خواست اوست، آیا نمی اندیشید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اوست آن خدايى كه زنده مى‌كند و مى‌ميراند و آمدوشد شب و روز از آن اوست. چرا تعقل نمى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اوست آن كه زنده مى‌كند و مى‌ميراند و آمد و شد شب و روز از اوست، پس چرا تعقل نمى‌كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اوست آن كس كه زنده مى‌كند و مى‌ميراند، و اختلاف شب و روز از اوست. مگر نمى‌انديشيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اوست خدایی که زنده گرداند و بمیراند و اختلاف و حرکت شب و روز به امر اوست، آیا شما عقل خود را کار نمی‌بندید (تا خداشناس شوید و اطاعت امر او کنید).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او است که زنده می‌گرداند و می‌میراند، و آمد و شد (پیاپی) شب و روز، (و اختلاف رنگ، و کوتاهی و درازی آنها برابر قوانین و طبق فرمان او و) مربوط بدو است. آیا (دلالت اینها را بر قدرت خدا و وجوب ایمان بدو و به روز قیامت) نمی‌فهمید؟ [[«إخْتِلاف»: آمد و شد. دگرگونی زمانی و فعل و انفعالات (نگا: بقره / 164، آل‌عمران / 190).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و او کسی است که زنده می‌دارد و می‌میراند و در پی یکدیگر آمدن شب و روز از اوست، آیا اندیشه نمی‌کنید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و او کسی است که زنده می‌کند و می‌میراند؛ و رفت و آمد شب و روز از آن اوست؛ آیا اندیشه نمی‌کنید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و او است آنکه زنده کند و بمیراند و برای او است گردش شبانه روز آیا بخرد نمی‌یابید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اوست كه زنده كند و بميراند، و او راست آمد و شد شب و روز آيا خرد را كار نمى‌بنديد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اوست کسی که زنده می‌کند و می‌میراند و (توانایی ایجاد) اختلاف شب و روز تنها برای اوست. پس مگر خردورزی نمی‌کنید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is He who gives you life and death, and His the alternation of night and day. Even then you do not understand,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And it is He Who gives life and causes death, and for Him are the alternations of night and day; so do you not have sense?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It is He who gives life, and makes to die, and to Him belongs the alternation of night and day; what, will you not understand?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And He it is Who quickeneth and causeth to die, and His is the alternation of night and day; will ye not then reflect?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And it is He Who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of night and day. Will you not then understand?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And it is He who gives life and brings death, and to Him is the alternation of night and day. Do you not understand?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It is He Who gives life and causes death, and He holds mastery over the alternation of night and day. Do you not understand this?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And it is He Who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of night and day. Will you not then understand

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And He it is Who giveth life and causeth death, and His is the difference of night and day. Have ye then no sense?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And it is He who gives life and brings death, and due to Him is the alternation of day and night. Do you not exercise your reason?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It is He who revives and makes to die, and to Him belong the alternation of the night and the day. Will you not understand!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is He who gives life and causes death and it is He who alternates night and day. Will you not then understand?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And He it is Who gives life and causes death, and (in) His (control) is the alternation of the night and the day; do you not then understand?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wahuwa allathee yuhyee wayumeetu walahu ikhtilafu allayli waalnnahari afala taAAqiloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He is the One who gives life and causes death and He controls the alternation of night and day. Will you not then understand?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: It is He Who gives life and death, and to Him (is due) the alternation of Night and Day: will ye not then understand?

verses.text: بَلْ‌ قَالُوا مِثْلَ‌ مَا قَالَ‌ الْأَوَّلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [نه اینکه نمی اندیشند] بلکه مانند همان [سخنان یاوه و بی منطق] را گفتند که پیشینیان گفتند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه، آنها نيز همان سخنان گفتند كه پيشينيان مى‌گفتند:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بلكه آنها نيز همان سخنان گفتند كه پيشينيان مى‌گفتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [نه،] بلكه آنان [نيز] مثل آنچه پيشينيان گفته بودند، گفتند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بلکه این مردم کافر هم همان سخن کافران پیشین را گفتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (چنین کاری را نکرده و نمی‌کنند) و بلکه سخنانی همچون سخنان پیشینیان را می‌گویند.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بلکه همانند آنچه پیشینیان گفتند، می‌گویند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (نه،) بلکه آنان نیز مثل آنچه پیشینیان گفته بودند گفتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بلکه گفتند همانند آنچه گفتند پیشینیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بلكه همان گفتند كه پيشينيان گفتند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بلکه آنان (نیز) همانند آنچه پیشینیان(شان) گفته بودند، گفتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And talk as did the people of old.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: On the contrary, they said the same as what the former people used to say.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Nay, but they said the like of what the ancients said.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Aye! they say the like of that which said the ancients.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay, but they say the like of what the men of old said.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But they say the like of what the ancients said.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Nay, but they say the like of what their predecessors of yore had said.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay, but they say the like of what the men of old said.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but they say the like of that which said the men of old;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed, they say, just like what the former peoples said.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No, but they said what the ancients said before them:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Rather, they say like what the former peoples said.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They say exactly the same thing as the people who lived before.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay, they say the like of what the ancients said:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Bal qaloo mithla ma qala alawwaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But they say the same as the ancients said,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: On the contrary they say things similar to what the ancients said.

verses.text: قَالُوا أَ إِذَا مِتْنَا وَ کُنَّا تُرَاباً وَ عِظَاماً أَ إِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفتند: [که] آیا زمانی که بمیریم و خاک و استخوان شویم حتماً برانگیخته می شویم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: آيا اگر ما بميريم و خاك و استخوان شويم باز هم زنده مى‌شويم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: آيا چون مرديم و خاك و استخوان شديم، واقعا باز برانگيخته مى‌شويم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «آيا چون بميريم و خاك و استخوان شويم، آيا واقعاً باز ما زنده خواهيم شد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که گفتند: از کجا که چون ما مردیم و استخوانی پوسیده و خاک شدیم باز مبعوث و زنده شویم؟!

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: می‌گویند: آیا هنگامی که ما مردیم و خاک و استخوان گشتیم، آیا واقعاً برانگیخته خواهیم شد (و زندگی دوباره پیدا خواهیم کرد؟!). [[«لَمَبْعُوثُونَ»: برانگیخته‌شدگان (نگا: هود / 7، انعام / 29، مؤمنون / 37).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گویند آیا چون مردیم، و خاک و استخوان [پوسیده‌] شدیم، از نو برانگیخته می‌شویم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها گفتند: «آیا هنگامی که مردیم و خاک و استخوانهایی (پوسیده) شدیم، آیا بار دیگر برانگیخته خواهیم شد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند آیا گاهی که مردیم و شدیم خاکی و استخوانهائی آیا مائیم برانگیختگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: آيا چون بمرديم و خاك و استخوان شديم باز هم برانگيخته مى‌شويم؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «آیا هنگامی که مردیم و خاک و استخوان بودیم، آیا بی‌چون، و بی‌گمان ما بازگشت‌شوندگانیم‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They say: "When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we be raised to life again?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They say, “Will we, when we die and turn into dust and bones, be raised again?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we be indeed raised up?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They say: when we are dead, and have become dust and bones, shall we verily be raised up?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They said: "When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected indeed?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They say, “After we have died, and become dust and bones, will we be resurrected?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They say: "Is it that when we are dead and have been reduced to dust and bones, shall we then be raised up again?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected indeed"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They say: When we are dead and have become (mere) dust and bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised again?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'When we are dead and become dust and bones shall we be resurrected?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They say, "When we die and become dust and bones, shall we then be raised up again?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They say: What! When we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we then be raised?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo aitha mitna wakunna turaban waAAithaman ainna lamabAAoothoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "When we have died and become dust and bones, will we be raised up again?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They say: "What! when we die and become dust and bones, could we really be raised up again?

verses.text: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا نَحْنُ‌ وَ آبَاؤُنَا هٰذَا مِنْ‌ قَبْلُ‌ إِنْ‌ هٰذَا إِلاَّ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همانا این [برانگیخته شدن] را پیش از این به ما و پدرانمان وعده دادند [ولی] این جز افسانه خرافی پیشینیان نیست؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به ما و پدرانمان نيز پيش از اين چنين وعده‌هايى داده شده بود. اينها چيزى جز افسانه‌هاى پيشينيان نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: درست همين را قبلا ما و پدرانمان وعده داده شده‌ايم اينها جز افسانه‌هاى پيشينيان نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: درست همين را قبلاً به ما و پدرانمان وعده دادند. اين جز افسانه‌هاى پيشينيان [چيزى‌] نيست.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: از این وعده‌ها بسیار به ما و پیش از این به پدران ما داده شد ولی اینها جز افسانه‌های پیشینیان نیست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این وعده به ما، و در گذشته به نیاکان ما داده شده است. امّا این چیزی جز دروغهای پیشینیان نیست (که آن را دهان به دهان برای یکدیگر روایت، و زمان به زمان برای همدیگر کتابت کرده‌اند). [[«أسَاطِیر»: جمع أُسْطُورَة، اکاذیب. دروغگوئیها (نگا: انعام / 25، فرقان / 5).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: به راستی که به ما و پدرانمان پیشترها چنین وعده‌ای داده‌اند، این جز افسانه‌های پیشینیان نیست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این وعده به ما و پدرانمان از قبل داده شده؛ این فقط افسانه‌های پیشینیان است!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا وعده داده شدیم ما و پدران ما این را از پیش نیست این جز افسانه‌های پیشینیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه به ما و پدرانمان از پيش اين وعده داده بودند، اين نيست مگر افسانه‌هاى پيشينيان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «درست همین را - از (زمانی) پیش - ما و پدرانمان همواره وعده داده شدیم. این جز افسانه‌ها و بافته‌های پیشینیان(شان چیزی) نیست.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We and our fathers were promised this before; it is nothing but ancient lore!"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Indeed this promise was given to us and before us to our forefathers – this is nothing but stories of earlier people.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We and our fathers have been promised this before; this is naught but the fairy-tales of the ancients.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Assuredly this we have been promised--we and our fathers-- aforetime: naught is this but the fables of the ancients.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Verily, this we have been promised, we and our fathers before (us)! This is only the tales of the ancients!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We were promised this before—we and our ancestors—these are nothing but legends of the ancients.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We were promised such things and so were our forefathers before us. All these are no more than tales of the past."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Verily, this we have been promised -- we and our fathers before! This is only (from) tales of the ancients!") Allah's saying:

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We were already promised this, we and our forefathers. Lo! this is naught but fables of the men of old.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly, we and our fathers were promised this before. [But] these are nothing but myths of the ancients.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We and our fathers have been promised this before. It is but of the ancients' fictitious tales'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before; this is not but legends of the former peoples."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Our fathers and we have been given such promises before. These are no more than ancient legends."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Certainly we are promised this, and (so were) our fathers aforetime; this is naught but stories of those of old.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Laqad wuAAidna nahnu waabaona hatha min qablu in hatha illa asateeru alawwaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We and our forefathers were promised this before. This is nothing but fables of the ancients."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Such things have been promised to us and to our fathers before! they are nothing but tales of the ancients!"

verses.text: قُلْ‌ لِمَنِ‌ الْأَرْضُ‌ وَ مَنْ‌ فِيهَا إِنْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ تَعْلَمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: اگر معرفت و شناخت دارید، بگویید: زمین و هر که در آن است از کیست؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: اگر مى‌دانيد، اين زمين و هر كه در آن است از آن كيست؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: اگر مى‌دانيد [بگوييد] زمين و هر كه در آن است به چه كسى تعلق دارد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «اگر مى‌دانيد [بگوييد] زمين و هر كه در آن است به چه كسى تعلق دارد؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو که زمین و هر کس که در او موجود است از کیست اگر شما فهم و دانش دارید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: زمین و کسانی که در زمین هستند از آن کیستند، اگر دانا و فرزانه‌اید؟! [[«إِن کُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ»: اگر فهمیده و آگاهید. این جمله متضمّن تحقیر مخاطبان بوده و اشاره به نادانی ایشان دارد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو اگر می‌دانید، زمین و هر کس که در آن است، از آن کیست؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «زمین و کسانی که در آن هستند از آن کیست، اگر شما می‌دانید؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو از آنِ کیست زمین و آنکه در آن است اگر هستید دانایان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: زمين و هر كه [و هر چه‌] در آن است از آن كيست، اگر مى‌دانيد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «اگر می‌دانسته‌اید، زمین و هر که در آن است برای کیست‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "To whom does the earth and whosoever is upon it then belong, if you know?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say O dear Prophet (Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “To Whom does the earth and all that is in it belong to, if you know?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'Whose is the earth, and whoso is in it, if you have knowledge?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: whose is the earth and whosoever is therein, if you know?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say: "Whose is the earth and whosoever is therein? If you know!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “To whom does the earth belong, and everyone in it, if you happen to know?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Ask them: "Whose is the earth and those who are in it? Tell us if you know"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "Whose is the earth and whosoever is therein If you know!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: Unto Whom (belongeth) the earth and whosoever is therein, if ye have knowledge?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘To whom does the earth belong and whoever it contains, if you know?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: "If you have knowledge, 'to whom belongs the earth' and, 'whoever is in it? '"

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, [O Muhammad], "To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), say to them, "Tell me, if you know, to whom does the earth and its contents belong?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: Whose is the earth, and whoever is therein, if you know?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul limani alardu waman feeha in kuntum taAAlamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "To whom do the earth and all therein belong? Tell me, if you have any knowledge?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "To whom belong the earth and all beings therein? (say) if ye know!"

verses.text: سَيَقُولُونَ‌ لِلَّهِ‌ قُلْ‌ أَ فَلاَ تَذَکَّرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: خواهند گفت: از خداست. بگو: با این حال آیا متذکّر نمی شوید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خواهند گفت: از آن خدا. بگو: آيا پند نمى‌گيريد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به زودى خواهند گفت: از آن خداست. بگو: پس آيا متذكّر نمى‌شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: خواهند گفت: «به خدا.» بگو: «آيا عبرت نمى‌گيريد؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: البته جواب خواهند داد که از خداست، بگو: پس چرا متذکر (قدرت خدا) نمی‌شوید (تا به عالم آخرت ایمان آرید).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (بر اساس ندای فطرت، و بداهت عقل) خواهند گفت: (همه‌ی کائنات، و از جمله زمین و ساکنان آن) از آن خدایند. بگو: پس چرا نمی‌اندیشید و یادآور نمی‌گردید (که تنها مالک کائنات شایسته‌ی پرستش است و بس؟). [[«اَفَلا تَذَکَّرُونَ»: تذکّر به معنی یادکردن و اندیشیدن و به خاطر آوردن است (نگا: انعام / 152). اصل (تَذَکَّرُونَ) تَتَذَکَّرُونَ است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: زودا که می‌گویند از آن خداست، بگو آیا پند نمی‌گیرید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بزودی (در پاسخ تو) می‌گویند: «همه از آن خداست!» بگو: «آیا متذکّر نمی‌شوید؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: زود است گویند برای خدا بگو پس چرا یادآور نمی‌شوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: خواهند گفت: خداى راست، بگو: پس آيا ياد نمى‌كنيد و پند نمى‌گيريد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به زودی خواهند گفت: «برای خداست.‌» بگو: «پس آیا (او را) به خوبی یاد نمی‌کنید؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will say: "To God." Say: "Then why do you not bethink yourselves?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Thereupon they will say, “To Allah”; proclaim, “Therefore why do you not ponder?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They will say, God's.' Say: 'Will you not then remember?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They will surely say: God's. Say thou: will ye not then heed?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They will say: "It is Allah's!" Say: "Will you not then remember?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will say, “To God.” Say, “Will you not reflect?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They will surely say: "Allah's." Say: "Then why do you not take heed?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They will say: "It is Allah's!" Say: "Will you not then remember"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They will say: Unto Allah. Say: Will ye not then remember?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They will say, ‘To Allah.’ Say, ‘Will you not then take admonition?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They will say: 'To Allah' Say: 'Then will you not remember'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They will say, "To Allah." Say, "Then will you not remember?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will quickly reply, "It belongs to God." Say, "Will you not, then, take heed?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They will say: Allah's. Say: Will you not then mind?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Sayaqooloona lillahi qul afala tathakkaroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will say, "To God." Say, "So will you not pay heed?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They will say, "To Allah!" say: "Yet will ye not receive admonition?"

verses.text: قُلْ‌ مَنْ‌ رَبُ‌ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ السَّبْعِ‌ وَ رَبُ‌ الْعَرْشِ‌ الْعَظِيمِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: مالک آسمان های هفتگانه و پروردگار عرش بزرگ کیست؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: كيست پروردگار آسمانهاى هفتگانه و پروردگار عرش بزرگ؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: كيست پروردگار آسمان‌هاى هفتگانه و صاحب عرش بزرگ

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «پروردگار آسمانهاى هفتگانه و پروردگار عرش بزرگ كيست؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز به آنها بگو: پروردگار آسمانهای هفتگانه و خداوند عرش بزرگ کیست؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: چه کسی صاحب آسمانهای هفتگانه و صاحب عرش عظیم است؟ (آیا ملک کائنات و فرمانروائی بر آنها از آن کیست؟). [[«الْعَرْش»: (نگا: اعراف / 54، توبه / 129).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو پروردگار آسمانهای هفت‌گانه و پروردگار عرش عظیم کیست؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «چه کسی پروردگار آسمانهای هفتگانه، و پروردگار عرش عظیم است؟»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو کیست پروردگار آسمانهای هفت‌گانه و پروردگار عرش بزرگ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: پروردگار آسمانهاى هفتگانه و پروردگار عرش بزرگ كيست؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «پروردگار آسمان‌های هفت‌گانه و پروردگار عرش بزرگ کیست‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "Then who is the Lord of the seven skies? And who is the Lord of the mighty Throne?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say, “Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, and the Lord of the Tremendous Throne?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the mighty Throne?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the mighty throne?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say: "Who is (the) Lord of the seven heavens, and (the) Lord of the Great Throne?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, and Lord of the Splendid Throne?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Ask them: "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, the Lord of the Great Throne?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "Who is (the) Lord of the seven heavens, and (the) Lord of the Great Throne"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: Who is Lord of the seven heavens, and Lord of the Tremendous Throne?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Great Throne?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, and of the Great Throne'
